item.title: A human-in-the-loop approach to collaborating with gen AI
item.description: Google Workspace is implementing a "human in the loop" approach for generative AI, positioning AI as a collaborative tool rather than a replacement for human work. Features like "Help me write" in Docs and Gmail, and "Help me organize" in Sheets, all powered by Gemini, emphasize human oversight and the ability to refine AI-generated content. This strategy aims to boost productivity responsibly while ensuring users maintain control, provide feedback, and uphold ethical standards in AI development.

item.title: More personalized and proactive assistance in Gmail coming to business customers
item.description: Google is enhancing Gmail for business customers with new AI-powered features, including personalized email summaries, "help me write" for drafting, and suggested replies, all integrated with Gemini. These capabilities, part of Google Workspace, aim to boost productivity and streamline communication for users, initially rolling out in English with broader availability planned. The update focuses on providing more proactive and personalized assistance to improve workflow efficiency.

item.title: Manage permission to edit group details and changes to groups settings
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out an update that allows Google Groups owners and managers to directly edit group details like descriptions, welcome messages, and contact email in Google Groups, removing the previous requirement for Google Admin console access. This enhancement streamlines group management by delegating specific permissions, reducing the administrative burden for IT teams. The feature is available to all Google Workspace customers and users with personal Google Accounts.

item.title: Educators can now get help drafting personalized guidance on written assignments with AI-suggested feedback in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Classroom is introducing an AI-powered drafting tool designed to assist educators in providing personalized, private feedback on written assignments directly within the grading interface. This feature, available to Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers, leverages student work and rubrics to generate guidance, aiming to save teachers time and enhance student learning. It is currently in an Alpha phase, rolling out to select users.

item.title: New 'Take notes for me' configuration in the Admin console for select Gemini Alpha customers
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing a new "Take notes for me" configuration in the Google Admin console, allowing admins of select Gemini Alpha customers to control user access to this AI-powered feature. This setting dictates whether users can enable automatic note, summary, action item, and next step generation from Google Meet sessions. The new control aims to provide administrators with enhanced management capabilities over AI features within their domain.

item.title: New user controls for Take notes for me
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out user-level controls for the "Take notes for me" feature within Google Meet, enabling participants to manage this AI-powered notetaking capability. If an administrator has enabled the feature, users can find the setting in Meet's activity controls to opt-in or out of automatically generating notes, summaries, action items, and next steps from their meetings. This control, available to select Gemini Alpha customers, is off by default, empowering users with agency over their meeting data.

item.title: Create custom soundtracks with Lyria 3 in the Gemini app
item.description: Google DeepMind has launched Lyria 3, an advanced music generation AI model, which powers the new MusicFX tool within AI Test Kitchen, accessible to users via text prompts. MusicFX enables the creation of custom soundtracks, offering control over genre, instruments, and tempo, thereby democratizing music composition. This innovation aims to provide users with a powerful and creative tool for music generation.

item.title: Forecast data in Connected Sheets using BigQuery ML and TimesFM
item.description: Google has integrated advanced forecasting capabilities into Connected Sheets, enabling users to generate accurate time-series forecasts directly from Google Sheets using BigQuery ML's new TimesFM model. This feature simplifies predictive analytics for large datasets stored in BigQuery, requiring no extensive coding and accessible to Google Workspace Enterprise Plus, Enterprise Standard, Enterprise Essentials Plus, and Education Plus customers.

item.title: Minutes to insights: Google’s finance transformation with Connected Sheets and BigQuery
item.description: Google's finance team, led by Cloud Finance Lead Andrew Miller under CFO Ruth Porat, achieved a significant finance transformation by integrating Connected Sheets with BigQuery, replacing complex legacy systems. This initiative empowered 180 finance professionals to directly access and analyze 4.5 billion rows of real-time data monthly, processing over 100 trillion records, which resulted in an annual saving of 500,000 work hours. The new system drastically improved data accuracy, efficiency, and enabled more strategic decision-making across Google's global operations.

item.title: Improvements to local administrative access controls on Windows devices
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out enhanced local controls for Windows devices, allowing administrators to manage local Administrator accounts, block new local admin creation, and restrict interactive sign-ins directly from the Google Admin console. These security and compliance features apply to Windows devices enrolled via Google Credential Provider for Windows (GCPW) or Google Enhanced Security for Windows (GESW), available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus, Enterprise Standard, and Education Plus customers.

item.title: View Gemini feature usage and threshold reports in the Admin console
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now monitor Gemini AI feature usage and manage consumption thresholds directly within the Google Admin console, providing detailed insights into user engagement with Gemini's capabilities. This new reporting and control functionality helps optimize AI resource utilization and is rolling out to various Google Workspace editions including Enterprise, Enterprise Plus, Business Standard, Business Plus, and Education Plus.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - February 13, 2026
item.description: This week's Google Workspace recap highlighted new Gemini integration into Google Docs for enhanced content drafting and summarization, alongside bolstered security features in Google Drive, including advanced data loss prevention (DLP) for enterprise clients. Further updates included improved moderation tools and background effects for Google Meet, and mobile editing enhancements in Google Sheets, all rolling out across various Workspace editions on both rapid and scheduled release tracks.

item.title: Listen to audio summaries in Google Docs
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing a new feature in Google Docs, allowing users to listen to AI-generated audio summaries of their documents. Powered by Gemini, this innovation aims to boost productivity and accessibility by enabling quick comprehension of lengthy texts, whether users are multitasking or prefer auditory learning. The feature is designed to enhance how users interact with document content, rolling out initially to select Workspace editions.

item.title: Introducing Figma in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is enhancing collaboration for design teams by integrating directly with Figma, enabling users to share design files and prototypes within their conversations. This integration facilitates immediate previews, streamlined feedback, and real-time notifications about design changes, significantly improving workflows for product development and creative projects. The aim is to reduce context switching and accelerate decision-making for teams leveraging both platforms.

item.title: Control if new Meet hardware can join calls with a new on/off setting
item.description: Google Workspace admins can now control whether new Google Meet hardware automatically joins scheduled video calls or requires manual acceptance, enhancing flexibility for device management in shared spaces. This new setting, found in the Google Admin console under "Device settings," prevents unexpected call joins and is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers starting February 3, 2026.

item.title: Data loss prevention policies for Google Calendar now available in beta
item.description: Google is extending Data Loss Prevention (DLP) capabilities to Google Chat, allowing admins to create custom rules to prevent sensitive information from being shared within messages and spaces. This enhancement, available to specific Google Workspace Enterprise and Education customers, applies to all new and edited Chat messages to bolster data security, ensure compliance, and prevent data exfiltration. The feature is enabled by default and rolls out starting February 13, 2026.

item.title: Move shared content in Google Meet to a separate window with the “Open in new window” option
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out a new layout feature that allows users to move shared content, like screen shares, to a side panel, thereby optimizing the main stage for participant video feeds. This update, aimed at improving the meeting experience and participant engagement, is enabled by default for all Google Workspace customers and allows easy switching between main stage and side panel views. The rollout commences on February 3, 2026, over a 15-day period.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - February 6, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for February 6, 2026, introduced several key updates, including enhanced Google Meet companion mode for more inclusive hybrid meetings available to all Workspace customers. Google Docs received new smart chips for improved project management, while Google Drive's AI-powered search within shared drives was refined for Business, Enterprise, Education, and Nonprofits. Additionally, Google Chat now supports custom emojis for all users, and the Google Workspace Admin Console gained granular external sharing security settings for Business Standard and higher editions.

item.title: Get higher access to advanced AI in Google Workspace
item.description: Google Workspace is significantly expanding access to its AI-powered features, including the Gemini model, across its suite of productivity applications. This initiative aims to bring enhanced capabilities, such as automated content generation in Google Docs, data analysis in Google Sheets, and presentation creation in Google Slides, to a broader range of users and regions globally. The expansion underscores Google's commitment to integrating advanced artificial intelligence directly into daily workflows to boost productivity and foster creativity for its users.

item.title: Expanding access to select Google Vids features for all users
item.description: Google Vids, the AI-powered video creation app within Google Workspace, is expanding access to more Workspace customers, including those on Business Standard and Plus, Enterprise Starter, Standard, Plus, and Education Plus tiers. This tool utilizes generative AI to assist with scriptwriting, storyboarding, and raw cut generation, streamlining the creation of business videos for various purposes. It integrates seamlessly with existing Workspace applications like Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides, enhancing collaboration and content management.

item.title: Proofread your email with Gemini in Gmail
item.description: Google is rolling out an integrated "Proofread" feature powered by Gemini directly within Gmail, allowing users to instantly refine their emails for grammar, spelling, conciseness, and tone. This enhancement leverages Gemini's advanced language model capabilities to suggest improvements and rewrite sentences, ensuring professional and effective communication. The feature is designed to boost productivity and confidence in written correspondence for Google Workspace users across various tiers.

item.title: Google Classroom API: Student groups endpoints are now available
item.description: The Google Classroom API is introducing new student group endpoints, empowering developers to programmatically manage student groupings within Classroom courses. This update facilitates robust integrations for EdTech platforms, enabling automated creation, modification, and deletion of student groups for collaborative assignments and differentiated instruction. These enhancements provide educators with more dynamic classroom management capabilities and support project-based learning initiatives.

item.title: Prepare for the JEE Main with practice tests in Gemini
item.description: Gemini is being utilized as an AI-powered study tool to help students prepare for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main, a crucial engineering entrance exam in India. It offers interactive problem-solving, detailed explanations across Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, and personalized study plans to clarify complex topics. This AI assistance provides 24/7 access to educational resources, enhancing student readiness and performance for competitive exams.

item.title: Speech translation in Google Meet now generally available for businesses
item.description: Google Meet's real-time speech translation feature has reached General Availability (GA), facilitating seamless communication across language barriers during video conferences. This feature supports translation from English into several languages, including Spanish, French, Portuguese, and German, significantly benefiting global teams and international collaborations. Available to Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers, it automatically translates spoken words into captions, enhancing meeting inclusivity and productivity.

item.title: Gemini in Chrome is coming to Chromebook Plus devices
item.description: Gemini in Chrome is set to launch on Chromebook Plus devices in early 2026, offering AI-powered writing assistance, webpage summarization, and image generation directly within the browser. This integration aims to enhance productivity and creativity by allowing users to draft content, understand complex information, and visualize ideas with Gemini's capabilities, specifically for Chromebook Plus users.

item.title: Select Gemini in Workspace capabilities now available to Education Plus and Teaching & Learning customers
item.description: Google is bringing Gemini to Google Workspace for Education, offering AI-powered assistance for educators to streamline tasks like lesson planning, email drafting, and document summarization. Students will also benefit from AI support for research, writing, and studying across applications like Docs, Gmail, and Slides, all while adhering to Google's privacy commitments for education.

item.title: New built-in interoperability between Google Meet and Microsoft Teams
item.description: Google Meet hardware now offers general availability for Microsoft Teams interoperability, allowing users to join Teams meetings with a single tap using Pexip's Cloud Video Interop or direct guest join via WebRTC. This feature supports a range of compatible Google Meet devices from partners like Poly and Logitech, aiming to reduce friction and streamline collaboration in hybrid work environments.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 30, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for January 30, 2026, unveiled key enhancements including improved Smart Chips and templates in Google Docs, refined conditional formatting and pivot table controls in Google Sheets, and new presenter tools for Google Slides. Significant AI integration was noted with Google Meet gaining AI-powered noise cancellation and expanded live captions, while Gemini provided new summarization in Docs, email drafting in Gmail, and Q&A in Sheets. Security was also boosted with enhanced suspicious activity alerts in Google Drive and new DLP policies via the Google Admin Console.

item.title: All Google Forms will now have granular controls over who can respond
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new granular controls for Google Forms, empowering administrators with enhanced capabilities to manage response collection and sharing. This update allows admins to set specific limits on submissions and dictate how responses are stored and accessed, improving data privacy and organizational efficiency. The improvements are particularly beneficial for educational institutions and businesses handling sensitive information, streamlining form management and data compliance.

item.title: Record audio, video, and screencasts directly in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing Google Classroom with new integrated tools for recording screencasts, audio, and video directly within the platform. This feature enables educators and students to easily create and share dynamic instructional content, video assignments, and presentations. The update aims to streamline the creation of engaging multimedia resources, supporting more flexible and interactive learning experiences in hybrid and remote education settings.

item.title: January Workspace Drop: SOTA AI avatars in Vids, deeper insights in the Gemini app, and new app integrations in Chat
item.description: The January Workspace Drop introduces significant AI-powered enhancements across Google Workspace, prominently featuring Gemini integration in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, Gmail, Meet, and Chat, enabling features like "Help me write" in Docs and AI-powered summarization in Chat. Updates also boost productivity with new organizing features and improved search in Google Drive, smart fill for data cleanup in Google Sheets, and enhanced collaboration tools in Google Meet's companion mode and picture-in-picture. These advancements aim to streamline workflows, enhance data management, and improve security within the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Calendar event color labels now also accessible to users with “Make changes to events” permission
item.description: Google Calendar is rolling out an update to enhance the accessibility and ease of modifying event color labels directly within the calendar interface. This improvement allows Google Workspace users to more efficiently customize their event organization, promoting clearer schedule management and improved accessibility for diverse user needs. The update aims to streamline how users interact with their daily appointments and tasks in Google Calendar, often integrated with tools like Google Meet and Google Drive.

item.title: Take your notebooks further by adding NotebookLM as a source in the Gemini app
item.description: NotebookLM, Google's AI-powered research and note-taking tool, is significantly enhanced by integrating with Gemini 1.5 Pro, allowing it to summarize Google Docs, PDFs, and web content, and analyze multiple sources to answer complex questions. The updated platform introduces a "Fact Check" feature for source verification and leverages Google Drive for document sourcing, serving as a comprehensive AI assistant for students, researchers, and writers in over 200 countries.

item.title: The 5-minute data dashboard: Visualize and analyze with Google Sheets
item.description: This Google Workspace blog post outlines how to create a data dashboard in under five minutes using Google Sheets' new AI-powered "smart fill" and "smart cleanup" features. These capabilities automate data preparation and organization, enabling users to quickly transform raw data from sources like Google Analytics into visual, actionable insights. The process simplifies data analysis, making it accessible for users to build dashboards without extensive manual data manipulation.

item.title: Better suggestions for meeting times with Gemini in Google Calendar
item.description: Google Calendar is significantly enhancing meeting scheduling capabilities with new Gemini-powered suggestions, leveraging AI to recommend optimal times and attendees. This integration analyzes user availability, preferences, and meeting content to streamline the planning process, aiming to boost productivity and ensure more effective collaborations.

item.title: New admin controls for "Take notes for me" sharing settings in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out a new "Take notes for me" feature, enabling AI to automatically generate meeting summaries, capture key decisions, and identify action items for participants. This update includes new administrative controls within the Google Workspace Admin console, allowing organizations to manage the feature's deployment and settings to ensure tailored and compliant usage.

item.title: Prepare for the SAT with full-length practice tests in Gemini
item.description: Google's Gemini AI now offers full-length SAT practice tests, providing students with comprehensive explanations, performance analysis, and personalized feedback directly within the platform. This new educational integration aims to streamline test preparation, helping students identify areas for improvement and optimize their study strategies for higher SAT scores. The feature leverages Gemini's advanced capabilities to create an adaptive and supportive learning environment.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 23, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace weekly recap for January 23, 2026, highlights several key updates including enhanced Google Docs version history, AI-driven pivot table insights in Google Sheets, and new background customization options for Google Meet. Additionally, the recap covers improved security alerts for Google Drive sharing and expanded Gemini integrations across Workspace applications. These updates collectively aim to boost productivity, security, and collaboration for users across the enterprise.

item.title: Styled captions in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids, an AI-powered video creation app within Google Workspace, is introducing new styled captions in January 2026 to enhance video accessibility and visual customization. This feature allows users to personalize caption appearance with various fonts, sizes, colors, and backgrounds, improving brand alignment and readability. Available for Google Workspace customers with Gemini Business and Enterprise add-ons, it aims to elevate professional communication in business and educational environments.

item.title: Ask Gemini in Google Meet is expanding to Workspace Business Standard customers, additional languages, and mobile usage
item.description: The "Ask Gemini" feature within Google Meet, enabling users to generate meeting recaps, action items, and custom summaries, is expanding its availability. Previously exclusive to higher-tier subscriptions, it will now roll out to Google Workspace Business Standard and Enterprise Essentials+ customers by January 2026. This extends advanced AI-powered meeting productivity tools to a broader user base.

item.title: Granular OAuth consent in Google Chat apps
item.description: Google Chat is enhancing security and privacy by introducing granular OAuth consent for Chat apps, rolling out from January 2026. This allows users to grant specific data access permissions, such as reading or sending messages, to third-party apps instead of broad access. The update gives users and administrators more control over app permissions, requiring developers to update their apps to support these new granular scopes.

item.title: View Google Meet usage metrics in Gemini reports dashboard
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now monitor Google Meet usage metrics related to Gemini directly within the Admin Console's Gemini reports. This feature provides valuable insights into user engagement with Gemini's capabilities in Meet, such as recaps, action items, and summaries, helping admins assess adoption and impact. The reporting feature is expected to be available for all Google Workspace customers with Gemini enabled by January 2026.

item.title: Forward messages in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is introducing a highly requested feature allowing users to forward single or multiple messages to individuals or spaces within Chat, improving communication efficiency. This functionality streamlines information sharing across different conversations, making it easier to relay important details without retyping or copy-pasting. The new message forwarding option is set to roll out to all Google Workspace customers by January 2026.

item.title: Increasing flexibility when rebooting Google Meet hardware with "Reboot when idle"
item.description: Google Meet hardware devices will soon feature an automatic reboot capability when idle, enhancing reliability and ensuring optimal performance through regular restarts and efficient application of updates. Administrators can configure the specific idle time before a reboot and schedule preferred reboot windows via the Google Admin console. This update is rolling out to all Google Meet hardware, improving device maintenance and operational stability.

item.title: Neat now a certified Google Meet hardware partner
item.description: Neat devices, including the Neat Bar 2, Neat Board 50, Neat Frame, Neat Pad, and Neat Pulse, have officially received certification as Google Meet hardware, significantly expanding the range of compatible conference room solutions. This integration offers Google Workspace users more flexible and high-quality options for video conferencing, leveraging Neat's specialized hardware for seamless meeting experiences. The certification enhances the ecosystem for modern collaboration spaces.

item.title: Automatic addition of owned secondary calendars to your calendar list
item.description: Google Calendar is rolling out an update that automatically adds user-owned secondary calendars to their calendar list, eliminating the previous manual addition process. This enhancement, available to all Google Workspace customers and personal Google Account users on web, Android, and iOS, improves discoverability and reduces friction for those managing multiple calendars for projects or teams. The rollout begins January 15, 2026, for Rapid Release domains and January 30, 2026, for Scheduled Release domains.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 16, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for January 16, 2026, highlighted significant updates including enhanced AI capabilities in Google Docs for summarizing and drafting, and improved collaboration features in Google Sheets with better version history and comment threading. Additionally, security enhancements were rolled out for Google Drive, focusing on advanced data loss prevention, alongside new integrations for Google Meet and ongoing developments with Gemini for Workspace.

item.title: Flow now available as an additional Google service for Workspace customers
item.description: Google has introduced "Flow" as a new service within Google Workspace, designed to streamline and automate workflows by integrating data and tasks across various applications. This new tool offers a visual workflow builder, pre-built templates, and conditional logic, enabling Workspace customers to boost efficiency and reduce manual errors. Admins can manage "Flow" through the Google Admin console, with a phased rollout planned for all Workspace editions.

item.title: Maximize output, minimize effort: Google Workspace with Gemini helps you move work forward in meetings
item.description: Google Workspace is making Gemini's AI capabilities generally available to all paying customers, significantly enhancing meeting productivity with features like "Take notes for me" in Google Meet, which automatically generates summaries, key points, and action items. This integration also introduces "Meet Companion Mode" for improved participation and "Translate in Google Meet" for real-time multi-language captions, all built on Google's responsible AI principles to ensure data privacy and security. These AI-powered tools connect seamlessly with other Workspace apps, including Docs, Sheets, and Slides, to streamline workflows across various business and education editions.

item.title: Editing password-protected Microsoft Office files directly in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive now allows users to open, edit, and save password-protected Microsoft Office files (DOCX, XLSX, PPTX) directly within Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides on both web and mobile (iOS/Android). This update streamlines collaboration by removing the need to remove password protection, enhancing productivity and security for shared documents. This feature enables real-time co-editing and version control without compromising file integrity.

item.title: SecOps data connector now available for Google Workspace for Education Plus and Standard
item.description: Google Workspace for Education Plus is introducing a new SecOps Data Connector, powered by Google Cloud's BigQuery, to stream audit logs and event data to leading Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platforms. This allows Education Plus customers to centralize security monitoring, simplify threat detection, and enhance incident response by integrating with systems like Splunk, CrowdStrike, and Palo Alto Networks Cortex XSOAR. The initiative aims to bolster the security posture of educational institutions, making it easier to identify and mitigate cyber threats.

item.title: Automatic room check-in for Google Meet available on mobile devices
item.description: Google Meet on mobile devices is introducing an automatic room check-in feature, streamlining the meeting experience for hybrid work environments. This functionality allows users to be automatically recognized and checked into a meeting room when their mobile device detects a paired Google Meet hardware device, eliminating the need for manual check-ins. The update aims to enhance user productivity by ensuring seamless meeting participation and provides Google Workspace administrators with improved insights into room utilization.

item.title: Ingredients to Video in Veo 3.1 now supports portrait-sized clips in Google Vids
item.description: Google is significantly enhancing the visual quality of video portrait feeds within Google Meet by leveraging advanced AI and machine learning capabilities. These improvements focus on optimizing various 'ingredients' such as lighting, background processing, and noise reduction, ensuring participants appear polished and professional during video calls regardless of their environment. This initiative aims to deliver a superior and more engaging video conferencing experience for all Google Meet users.

item.title: Set Google Forms to automatically stop accepting responses based on date and time or response count
item.description: Google Forms is introducing an enhanced feature allowing users greater control over response collection by enabling both manual and automatic closure of forms. Users will now be able to schedule forms to stop collecting responses on a specific date and time, or after reaching a predefined maximum number of submissions. This update provides significant benefits for educators, event planners, and businesses managing surveys, quizzes, and registrations, aiming to streamline data management and prevent over-collection within Google Forms.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 9, 2026
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for January 9, 2026, details several key updates: Google Chat is receiving enhanced file discovery features, while Google Meet gains more granular admin controls for external participant access and recording policies via the Google Admin console. Additionally, Google Drive is rolling out AI-powered suggestions for file organization, and Gemini integration in Google Docs is expanding to offer advanced summarization and draft generation capabilities, boosting AI-powered productivity.

item.title: Emojis reactions in Gmail will now be on by default
item.description: Effective January 2026, emoji reactions in Gmail will be turned on by default for all users, enhancing email expressiveness and streamlining communication within Google Workspace. While the feature will be automatically enabled, users will still have the option to disable emoji reactions through their individual Gmail settings, offering flexibility for user preference.

item.title: More user control for “Take notes for me” in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is introducing new, granular controls for its Gemini-powered "Take notes for me" feature, allowing users to actively manage privacy and access to AI-generated meeting summaries. These upcoming settings will empower participants to decide if the AI assistant records meeting notes, which are then seamlessly integrated with Google Docs within the broader Google Workspace ecosystem to enhance post-meeting productivity and information sharing. This update aims to provide greater user oversight and customization over AI functionality during virtual collaborations.

item.title: Control Speech Translation in Google Meet for your users
item.description: Google Meet is introducing enhanced controls for speech translation, allowing meeting organizers to manage real-time translation settings, including enabling or disabling the feature and selecting specific language pairs. This update aims to improve accessibility and foster global collaboration by providing users with more granular control over spoken language translations to ensure seamless communication during virtual meetings.

item.title: Generate podcast-style audio lessons in Google Classroom using Gemini
item.description: Google Classroom is set to integrate Gemini AI to facilitate the creation and delivery of AI-powered audio lessons, allowing educators to develop engaging, accessible content that caters to diverse learning styles. This feature aims to streamline lesson preparation and offer students personalized auditory learning experiences directly within the platform, enhancing both teaching efficiency and student engagement.

item.title: Now generally available: Migrate files from Dropbox to Google Drive
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new migration capabilities, expected in January 2026, enabling users to seamlessly transfer files and folders directly from Dropbox into Google Drive. This update aims to simplify data migration for organizations adopting Google Workspace, providing administrators with streamlined tools for secure and efficient cloud storage consolidation. The feature enhances Google Drive's integration, facilitating easier transitions for businesses moving their data within the Google ecosystem.

item.title: Manage Apple Intelligence Writing Tools in Google Workspace iOS apps
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new administrative controls to manage Apple's Scribble feature within Workspace applications on iOS devices. This update allows administrators to enable or disable the use of Apple Pencil's handwriting-to-text functionality for end-users when interacting with Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides on managed iPhones and iPads. The feature aims to provide IT departments with enhanced oversight regarding data input methods into critical business applications, balancing productivity with compliance and security needs.

item.title: Transform sources into structured Data Tables in NotebookLM
item.description: NotebookLM is introducing a new feature, powered by Google's Gemini family of models, that transforms unstructured information from various source documents like PDFs, Google Docs, and web pages into structured data tables. This capability allows users to streamline research, analysis, and content creation by organizing and extracting actionable data directly within NotebookLM. Users gain control over column selection and table refinement, enhancing efficiency for researchers and creators by making information more accessible and useful.

item.title: Users of all ages can now generate images in the Gemini app when signed into their Workspace account
item.description: Google Workspace is integrating Gemini's image generation capabilities directly into its applications, enabling users to create images from text prompts with built-in content safety filters designed for all ages. This feature emphasizes responsible AI use and is rolling out to Workspace Labs in December 2023, with wider availability anticipated in 2024. The initiative enhances creative productivity while prioritizing user safety within the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Google Workspace audit log API enhancements now available
item.description: The Google Workspace Audit Log API is now Generally Available, offering administrators programmatic access to critical security logs from services like Google Drive, Google Calendar, Admin, Google Meet, and Google Groups. This API facilitates robust integration with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platforms, including Splunk and Microsoft Sentinel. The enhancement significantly improves an organization's visibility into Workspace activity, aiding in incident detection, response, and compliance efforts.

item.title: How Bison Coolers relies on Google to run its family business
item.description: Bison Coolers, a premium outdoor gear manufacturer, revolutionized its operations by integrating Google Pixel 7 Pro and Pixel 8 Pro smartphones with Google Workspace for its employees. CEO Jeremy Ggoins, Operations Manager Brian Miller, and Digital Marketing Manager Jeff Minter utilize Pixel devices to streamline inventory management, quality control, and remote factory communications through Google Meet and secure Google Drive access, enhancing collaboration and problem-solving. This adoption provides field reps with secure data access and demonstration tools, improving overall efficiency and reducing operational downtime.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - December 19, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for December 19, 2025, highlighted significant platform enhancements, including the rollout of Gemini-powered image generation directly within Workspace applications, designed with robust content safety features for all users. The recap also announced the General Availability of the Google Workspace Audit Log API, which provides administrators programmatic access to security logs from various Workspace services for improved threat detection and compliance. These updates collectively reinforce Google's ongoing commitment to advancing both productivity and security capabilities within its Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: A breakthrough year for apps in Google Chat
item.description: Google is evolving its Chat app framework for Google Workspace, aiming for richer, more dynamic user experiences and developer capabilities by Q1 2025. This initiative will enable more interactive bots and seamless integrations with business applications directly within Google Chat, enhancing productivity and collaboration. Developers will need to update existing apps using new tools and migration guides to leverage these advancements.

item.title: Google AI Ultra for Business plan adds enhanced NotebookLM experience
item.description: Google is significantly enhancing NotebookLM with Gemini 1.5 Pro capabilities, specifically tailored for business users to deliver faster insights and process larger document sets securely within an enterprise-grade environment. This update boosts NotebookLM's ability to analyze information, generate summaries, and answer questions across extensive sources, integrated seamlessly with Google Workspace.

item.title: Introducing Gemini 3 Flash for the Gemini app
item.description: Google is launching Gemini 3 Flash, a new, lightweight, and fast AI model for the Gemini app, designed to provide quick responses and creative generation on mobile and web platforms. This model emphasizes efficiency and accessibility, supporting multimodal inputs to enhance everyday tasks for users.

item.title: Our best avatars in Google Vids yet, now powered by Veo 3.1
item.description: Google Vids, an AI-powered video creation tool, is integrating Veo 3.1 to offer more realistic and customizable AI-generated avatars. This enhancement allows users to select from a broader range of styles, expressions, and voices, enabling the rapid creation of professional-quality videos for business communications and storytelling.

item.title: Block messages from unknown senders in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is introducing a new security feature that allows users to automatically block direct messages from unknown senders, specifically those outside their organization or not in their contacts. This aims to reduce spam, mitigate phishing risks, and enhance user safety and focus within the communication platform.

item.title: Keep your team informed: Introducing the Feeds app for Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is launching a new "Feeds" app designed to aggregate and display content from diverse sources like news, RSS feeds, and project updates directly within chat spaces. This feature aims to streamline information flow, keep teams updated without leaving Google Chat, and enhance overall collaboration by centralizing relevant data.

item.title: Share your device’s audio when presenting in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is enhancing its presentation capabilities by allowing users to share all system audio from their device, beyond just individual browser tab audio. This feature is vital for presentations that incorporate audio from desktop applications or video players, ensuring all participants experience a complete multimedia presentation during virtual meetings.

item.title: Share stereo sound with audio content in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is further enhancing its audio capabilities by introducing support for sharing stereo sound during meetings, building upon its existing audio sharing features. This update is especially beneficial for sharing music performances, high-fidelity audio, or professional multimedia content, providing a richer and more immersive auditory experience for all participants.

item.title: Accelerate validation of Google Meet eCDN configuration at scale with Silent Test Mode
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out a new "silent test" feature that allows IT administrators to validate their Enterprise Content Delivery Network (ECDN) configuration without impacting live meetings. This proactive testing ensures optimal network performance and efficient bandwidth management for large-scale Google Meet deployments, enhancing overall stability.

item.title: Boost your agency's efficiency: Take Google Workspace for a test drive
item.description: Google Cloud is offering public sector organizations a 60-day, no-cost "Google Workspace Test Drive" program to experience its capabilities for digital transformation and hybrid work. This program highlights secure collaboration, AI features like Gemini for Workspace, data loss prevention, and FedRAMP High authorization, allowing government agencies to evaluate tools like Gmail, Docs, Sheets, and Meet. The initiative aims to provide hands-on experience and support from Google Cloud experts to demonstrate enhanced productivity and compliance.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - December 12, 2025
item.description: This week's Google Workspace updates include the launch of call queuing for Google Voice, automated compliance recording in Google Meet, and new multi-party approvals for critical actions in Google Vault. Additionally, Gmail now supports data classification headers and footers, and a new web address for Google Chat is being consolidated at chat.google.com.

item.title: Schedule messages to be sent at a later time in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is introducing a 'Schedule Send' feature, allowing users to compose messages and schedule them for later delivery, enhancing flexibility and productivity. This functionality is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers and users with personal Google Accounts starting December 16, 2025.

item.title: A new web address for Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is consolidating its web presence to a single dedicated URL, `chat.google.com`, with existing `mail.google.com/chat` and other `chat.google.com/` URLs redirecting to the new address. This change, rolling out from December 16, 2025, aims to simplify access and provide a more consistent user experience for all Google Chat users.

item.title: Gmail data classification update: include header or footer message
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now configure Gmail to automatically add custom headers and footers to emails based on their data classification labels, ensuring sensitive information is clearly marked. This feature, available for Google Workspace Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Standard, and Plus editions, helps organizations adhere to data governance and compliance policies.

item.title: Beyond the hype: 5 practical ways to use AI-powered visual content at work
item.description: This Google Workspace blog post details five practical applications of AI in visual content, showcasing how generative AI features enhance productivity and collaboration across various industries. It highlights AI's role in streamlining content creation within Google Slides, intelligent organization in Google Photos, and dynamic presentations in Google Meet, aiding teams from marketing to education. These AI-powered tools empower users to quickly generate professional-quality visuals, summarize information, and improve content accessibility, making visual communication more impactful and efficient.

item.title: Protect sensitive Google Vault actions with multi-party approvals
item.description: Google Vault is introducing multi-party approvals for critical administrative actions, such as data exports or legal hold deletions, requiring confirmation from multiple designated administrators. This new security measure, available to all Google Workspace editions, strengthens compliance and protects sensitive data within the eDiscovery and information governance platform.

item.title: The AI disconnect: How leaders can translate optimism into measurable impact
item.description: Google's research, involving Dr. Amy Stapleton and Google DeepMind, explores how AI, particularly Gemini in Workspace, can foster creativity, critical thinking, and innovation rather than merely saving time. The study highlights AI's potential to augment human capabilities, allowing users to move beyond routine tasks and engage in deeper problem-solving and strategic work. This perspective shifts the focus from AI as a mere efficiency tool to a catalyst for enhanced human intelligence and novel solutions.

item.title: Implement automated compliance recording and transcripts for selected Google Meet users
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out automated compliance recording, allowing Google Workspace administrators to set policies for automatically recording video meetings for specific organizational units or groups. This feature, available to Google Workspace Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Standard, and Plus customers, ensures adherence to regulatory requirements and internal policies.

item.title: Google Workspace is the “new default” for The Carbon Group's fractional C-suite services
item.description: The Carbon Group, an Australian financial services firm, transitioned 180 employees from Microsoft to Google Workspace, standardizing on tools like Google Sheets, Drive, Meet, Gmail, and Docs. This move significantly improved collaboration, security, and productivity across their 13 offices, enabling real-time file sharing, streamlined communication, and efficient onboarding of new team members. The shift has made Google Workspace the company's default platform, centralizing operations and enhancing the hybrid work experience.

item.title: Call queuing now available for select Google Voice plans
item.description: Google Voice is introducing Call Queuing for Standard and Premier accounts, enabling businesses to manage high call volumes by placing callers in a queue with customizable greetings and estimated wait times. This feature, rolling out from December 16, 2025, aims to improve customer service and call management efficiency.

item.title: Invite external guests to Google Meet live streams or limit access for targeted internal live streaming
item.description: Google Meet now supports external live streaming, allowing organizations to broadcast meetings directly to a wider audience via YouTube or custom RTMP services, supporting up to 100,000 viewers. This feature, available to Google Workspace Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Plus, and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers, is ideal for large events and public broadcasts, with Q&A and polling capabilities coming soon.

item.title: Meet now automatically opens picture-in-picture when screen sharing
item.description: Google Meet is enhancing the web user experience by automatically activating Picture-in-Picture (PiP) mode when users navigate away from the Meet tab. This ensures participants can continue viewing the speaker and captions without manual intervention, improving multitasking and engagement.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - December 5, 2025
item.description: This week's Google Workspace updates include the launch of Workspace Studio for AI-powered solution creation, Gemini insights for Google Drive folders, and a refreshed user interface for Google Drive's web file viewer. Additionally, Google Meet hardware now supports BYOD functionality via Chrome OS touch controllers and introduces seamless room connection for meetings.

item.title: BYOD on Google Meet on Chrome OS touch controller rooms
item.description: Google Meet hardware devices with Chrome OS touch controllers now support Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) functionality, allowing users to connect their laptops via USB-C to utilize the room's camera, speaker, and microphone. This enhances interoperability and flexibility for hybrid meetings, supporting any meeting platform.

item.title: A more modern interface for viewing PDFs, videos, images, and audio files in Google Drive on the web
item.description: Google Drive on the web is introducing a refreshed, modern file viewer interface, aligning with Material Design 3 for improved navigation and accessibility. This update, rolling out gradually from December 16, 2025, enhances the user experience and provides consistency across Google Workspace applications.

item.title: Introducing Google Workspace Studio: Automate everyday work with AI agents
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing Google Workspace Studio and Agents, enabling organizations to build custom AI agents powered by Gemini to automate routine tasks and enhance productivity across various departments. These low-code/no-code agents, leveraging Google Cloud's AppSheet and Vertex AI, can perform functions like managing customer support requests, onboarding employees, or analyzing data within Workspace applications. The initiative aims to democratize AI development, allowing businesses to create tailored solutions for specific workflows without extensive coding expertise.

item.title: Now available: Create AI agents to automate work with Google Workspace Studio
item.description: Workspace Studio, an AI-powered hub, is now available for Google Workspace customers to discover, manage, and create generative AI solutions and custom workflows. It integrates with tools like AppSheet and Apps Script, enabling businesses to leverage AI to automate tasks and enhance productivity within Google Sheets, Docs, and other Workspace apps.

item.title: Get quick insights on your Google Drive folders with Gemini
item.description: Gemini in Google Workspace now provides AI-powered insights for Google Drive folders, allowing users to quickly understand content, identify key information, and summarize documents within their files. This new capability, available for Workspace Enterprise, Education, and other specific editions, significantly boosts productivity and content management efficiency.

item.title: Seamlessly join meetings on Google Meet hardware with “Connect room”
item.description: Google Meet hardware users can now leverage the new 'Connect room' feature to wirelessly link their laptop to the room's hardware, enabling them to use the system's camera, microphone, and speakers while running the meeting from their personal device. This capability, rolling out to Chrome OS touch controllers, offers a streamlined and flexible meeting experience.

item.title: A refreshed user interface for Google Meet hardware touch controllers
item.description: Google Meet hardware touch controllers are receiving a refreshed user interface, aligning with Material Design 3 for a more intuitive, consistent, and user-friendly experience. This update, rolling out to all Chrome OS and Android touch controllers, simplifies meeting controls and enhances accessibility within conference rooms.

item.title: 10 best practices for deploying AI at scale
item.description: Deploying AI at scale requires a strategic, enterprise-wide approach that extends beyond initial pilot projects, focusing on responsible AI practices, data governance, and robust change management. Key best practices include embedding AI into organizational culture, developing a clear AI strategy, establishing strong data foundations, and continuously monitoring AI model performance and impact. Google Workspace and Gemini can facilitate this scaling by providing integrated tools, but success ultimately hinges on a comprehensive strategy addressing both technological and human aspects of AI adoption.

item.title: Google Meet translated captions now available in Cantonese
item.description: Google Meet is expanding its translated captions feature to include Cantonese, allowing users to understand conversations in real-time across language barriers during meetings. This enhances accessibility and fosters global communication for Google Workspace Business Plus, Enterprise, and Education Plus customers.

item.title: Choose your preferred caption language for Meet live streams on mobile devices
item.description: Mobile users watching Google Meet live streams can now select their preferred language for translated captions directly from their devices, providing a more inclusive viewing experience. This feature, available for Google Workspace Enterprise and Education Plus customers, enhances accessibility for a global audience.

item.title: New to Gmail: share emails in Google Chat
item.description: Users can now directly share emails from Gmail into Google Chat spaces and group messages, streamlining collaboration by allowing conversations to continue alongside relevant email content. This integration, launching December 16, 2025, enhances productivity and workflow by keeping communication consolidated.

item.title: Educators can now assign public notebooks in Google Classroom
item.description: Educators using NotebookLM can now assign public Notebooks to students, enabling them to leverage AI-powered summarization, question-answering, and content creation tools. This integration with Google Classroom allows for enhanced learning experiences directly within assignments, fostering critical thinking and research skills.

item.title: Control whether users can request to join a space in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat space managers now have enhanced control over external collaboration by being able to configure 'request to join' settings, allowing them to manually approve or automatically accept requests from users outside their organization. This feature, rolling out from December 16, 2025, improves security and management of shared spaces for Google Workspace customers.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 28, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for November 28, 2025, highlights several key updates including granular OAuth consent for web apps and enhanced visibility of data classification labels in Google Drive for end-users. Other significant improvements include deeper integration with Egnyte, improved Meet streaming metrics, expanded language support for Drive video captions, and the introduction of Gemini in Google Classroom for higher education. These updates aim to boost security, collaboration, and accessibility across the Workspace suite.

item.title: How Bison Coolers relies on Google to run its family business
item.description: Bison Coolers, a Texas-based family business manufacturing rotomolded coolers, transitioned from a costly Microsoft Exchange setup to Google Workspace to enhance collaboration and reduce IT overhead. Leveraging tools like Gmail, Google Drive, Docs, and Sheets, alongside Google Meet and Chat, the company streamlined communication, enabled remote work, and scaled from three to over 20 employees. This shift significantly improved productivity for traveling sales teams, provided cost savings, and bolstered disaster recovery capabilities for their growing business operations.

item.title: November Workspace Drop: Nano Banana Pro in Slides, Vids, and the Gemini app, plus AI to make meetings more impactful
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing a suite of new AI-powered features, including Google Vids, an AI-powered video creation app to generate scripts and storyboards from scratch, set to launch in Workspace Labs in 2024. Google Slides will gain a 'Help me visualize' feature for generative AI image creation and Gemini integration for drafting, while Google Meet receives background music and enhanced audio capabilities, and Google Docs sees smart chip improvements. These updates aim to significantly boost productivity and creativity across the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Fine-tune your network for Meet live streaming with extended quality metrics
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out enhanced live streaming metrics within the Quality Tool, allowing Workspace admins to access granular data on viewership, network bandwidth, and device performance for specific live stream events. These improvements, available for Business Standard and higher, Enterprise, and Education Plus customers, enable better troubleshooting and network optimization for large-scale virtual gatherings. The feature is currently rolling out, with a scheduled release starting December 9, 2025.

item.title: Automatically generated captions for videos in Google Drive now available in more languages
item.description: Google Drive has significantly expanded its video captioning capabilities, now supporting over 20 new languages for auto-generated captions beyond English. This update aims to enhance accessibility and foster global collaboration for all Google Workspace customers and personal Google Account users. The feature is rolling out now, with a scheduled release for all users starting December 9, 2025.

item.title: Data classification labels visible in more places across Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is enhancing data security and user awareness by making data classification labels, previously admin-facing, visible directly to end-users on files in Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides. This feature, available for Workspace Enterprise Plus, Education Standard, and Education Plus customers, aims to promote responsible data handling by clearly indicating sensitivity levels like "Confidential" or "Internal." The rollout begins immediately for Rapid Release domains and December 9, 2025, for Scheduled Release.

item.title: Granular OAuth consent in web apps and Google Workspace add-ons
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing granular OAuth consent for web applications, allowing users to selectively grant or deny specific permissions to third-party apps integrating with Google services, moving beyond "all or nothing" access. This enhancement provides users with greater control over their data and improves security when connecting external applications. The feature is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers starting November 27, 2025, for Rapid Release and December 11, 2025, for Scheduled Release domains.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 21, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for November 21, 2025, highlights updates including new Google Meet link behavior for recurring Google Calendar events, ensuring consistent meeting access. Other significant announcements cover enhancements to Google Workspace Nano Banana Pro, deeper collaboration capabilities between Google Workspace and Egnyte, the ability to preview unread Google Chat messages, and the integration of Gemini into Google Classroom for higher education. These updates aim to streamline workflows, improve communication, and enhance learning experiences.

item.title: Preview unread Google Chat messages from the left-hand menu
item.description: Google Chat is introducing a new feature allowing users to preview unread messages by hovering over them, without marking the conversation as read. This functionality, available on web and desktop apps with mobile coming soon, aims to improve message triage and efficiency for all Google Workspace customers. The update is rolling out now, with a scheduled release starting December 9, 2025.

item.title: Collaborate seamlessly across Google Workspace and Egnyte
item.description: Google Workspace has launched an enhanced integration with Egnyte, allowing users to seamlessly access, edit, and collaborate on Egnyte files directly from Google Workspace applications such as Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides. This streamlines workflows for organizations leveraging both platforms, fostering greater productivity and ensuring data consistency. The feature is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers, with a full deployment expected by December 9, 2025.

item.title: Introducing Nano Banana Pro in Slides, Vids, Gemini app, and NotebookLM
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing "Google Workspace Nano Banana Pro," a new initiative designed to deliver an enhanced mobile-first productivity experience for Workspace users. This offering optimizes Workspace applications for smaller screens, focusing on a simplified UI, faster access to common tasks, and improved offline capabilities to bridge the gap between desktop and mobile workflows. It is rolling out to all Workspace customers, with a scheduled release starting December 9, 2025.

item.title: New Google Meet links when changing recurrence or start time of recurring Calendar events
item.description: Google Meet is improving link management for recurring Google Calendar events by ensuring that Meet links automatically update when an organizer modifies the event. This enhancement aims to prevent join issues and maintain consistency, reducing user confusion when accessing ongoing meetings. The feature is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers, with a full deployment expected by December 9, 2025.

item.title: Gemini in Google Classroom is expanding to students in higher education
item.description: Google is integrating Gemini, its advanced AI model, into Google Classroom for higher education, providing educators and students with powerful tools to enhance learning and teaching efficiency. Gemini will assist with tasks such as generating quiz questions, summarizing complex texts, offering feedback, and aiding brainstorming sessions. This AI-powered capability is initially available through an early access program for Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Single-sign on with custom OpenID Connect profiles now generally available
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing its security and access management capabilities by introducing support for custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) providers for Single Sign-On (SSO), moving beyond traditional SAML-based identity providers. This update offers organizations greater flexibility to integrate existing OIDC-compliant identity providers for authenticating users across Google Workspace applications like Drive, Gmail, and Docs. The feature will be available to all Google Workspace editions, including Business Standard and Enterprise Plus, starting in late Q4 2025.

item.title: Introducing Gemini 3 Pro for Gemini app
item.description: Google is integrating Gemini 3 Pro, a new, more advanced multimodal AI model, directly into the Gemini app, offering significantly enhanced capabilities in text, image, and audio understanding. This update provides Gemini app users with sophisticated reasoning, longer context windows, and improved performance for complex tasks such as drafting emails in Gmail and summarizing documents in Google Docs. Gemini 3 Pro will initially be available to Gemini Advanced subscribers, with a broader rollout planned for all eligible users in late 2025.

item.title: Use Veo 3.1 ingredients-to-video to create clips from images in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids, a new AI-powered video creation app for Workspace, is being introduced to help users create professional-looking videos for business communications, training, and marketing. It leverages generative AI capabilities from Gemini and Veo to assist with scriptwriting, storyboarding, voiceovers, and asset selection, making video production accessible even without professional editing skills.

item.title: Block off time to work on a task in Calendar
item.description: Google Calendar is introducing a new feature that enables users to block out dedicated time for tasks, similar to scheduling events. This enhancement aims to help individuals prioritize and allocate specific periods for task completion directly within their calendar, improving time management and overall productivity.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 14, 2025
item.description: The weekly recap for November 7, 2025, highlights several Google Workspace updates, including new controls in Google Chat for restricting conversation creation and the ability to set sharing expirations for files and folders in Google Drive. Additionally, Google Calendar now supports secondary calendar management with dedicated owners, and Google Meet offers an option for longer meeting notes.

item.title: From spreadsheet jockey to strategic advisor: My journey with AI-powered Google Sheets
item.description: Nick, a financial analyst, shares his journey using AI, specifically Google Sheets with Gemini integration, to transform his financial modeling and data analysis workflows. He leveraged Gemini to quickly analyze data, extract insights, and generate Apps Script code for automating repetitive tasks like updating P&L statements. This significantly enhanced efficiency and reduced manual effort, allowing him to focus on strategic insights rather than data cleanup.

item.title: Help me create in Google Forms now available in seven additional languages
item.description: Google Forms is expanding its "Help me create" AI feature, powered by Gemini, to support seven new languages including Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Japanese, and Korean. This update enables users to generate forms, surveys, and quizzes from simple text prompts in more languages, significantly enhancing global accessibility and efficiency for form creation.

item.title: Desk phone support and on-demand call recording now available in the Google Voice Starter plan
item.description: Google Voice Starter is being updated to include support for desk phone integration and call recording capabilities for all users, including those under 18, starting November 11, 2025. Administrators can now assign desk phones through the Google Admin console and enable automatic or on-demand call recording to enhance flexibility and compliance for small businesses.

item.title: Analyze large-scale .csv files in Google Sheets with a new direct-to-BigQuery import
item.description: Google Sheets now enables users to analyze large-scale CSV files stored in Google Drive, supporting datasets up to 10 million cells without impacting the Sheet's internal cell limit. Rolling out from November 11, 2025, this enhancement allows for efficient data exploration, filtering, sorting, and pivot table creation on massive datasets.

item.title: Option for longer meeting notes with “take notes for me” in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is introducing the option for significantly longer meeting notes, expanding beyond the previous 2,500-character limit. These enhanced notes are automatically saved to Google Docs, improving the ability to capture detailed discussions and action items directly from the meeting interface.

item.title: Available in open beta: Migrate files from Dropbox to Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is simplifying the migration process from Dropbox, allowing administrators to seamlessly transfer files and folder structures to Google Drive. This update aims to ease the transition for organizations consolidating their cloud storage solutions and enhances data management within Google Workspace.

item.title: Improving secondary calendar management with dedicated owners
item.description: Google Calendar is enhancing its management capabilities for secondary calendars, allowing administrators to assign dedicated owners. This update provides greater control over scheduling, ensuring specific users are responsible for managing and maintaining particular calendars, thereby improving organization and accountability.

item.title: New AI-powered audio overviews for PDFs in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing AI-powered audio overviews for PDFs, allowing users to listen to summaries of their documents instead of reading them. This accessibility feature leverages artificial intelligence to quickly convey key information from complex documents, enhancing productivity and information consumption on the go.

item.title: Leverage the power of Gemini models to apply data classification labels in Google Drive - beta applications now open
item.description: Gemini is integrating with Google Drive to provide AI-powered data classification, automatically categorizing and tagging files based on their content. This enhancement helps organizations improve data governance, security, and discoverability by ensuring sensitive information is correctly identified and managed.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 7, 2025
item.description: This weekly recap for November 7, 2025, summarizes key updates across Google Workspace, including advancements in Google Meet for longer meeting notes, Google Drive's new migration tools from Dropbox, and enhanced secondary calendar management in Google Calendar. It highlights a range of improvements aimed at boosting productivity and collaboration for users.

item.title: Use a wider range of emoji reactions in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is expanding its range of emoji reactions, offering users more diverse ways to express themselves during video calls without interrupting the speaker. This update enhances non-verbal communication and engagement, allowing participants to share quick feedback and sentiments in a more dynamic and interactive meeting environment.

item.title: Gemini Deep Research now integrates with your Workspace content
item.description: Gemini is now integrating deep research capabilities directly with Google Workspace content, allowing users to leverage AI for comprehensive analysis of their own documents, emails, and shared files. This feature significantly enhances information synthesis and productivity by providing AI-driven insights relevant to a user's specific work context.

item.title: Bringing inline threading to direct messages in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is introducing inline threading for direct messages, allowing users to respond directly to specific messages within a 1:1 or group chat. This feature improves conversation clarity and organization by keeping related replies grouped together, making it easier to follow discussions and manage multiple topics simultaneously.

item.title: Set sharing expirations on files and folders in shared drives
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing data security and management by allowing users to set sharing expirations for files and folders directly within Google Drive. This feature ensures that access to sensitive documents automatically revokes after a specified period, reducing the risk of unauthorized long-term access and improving compliance.

item.title: Because you asked: Take prompting to the next level
item.description: This article shares advanced prompting techniques for generative AI, emphasizing the importance of clear, specific instructions and iterative refinement. Key strategies include defining roles, providing examples, breaking down complex tasks, and utilizing a 'chain of thought' approach to guide AI models like Gemini towards better outputs, enhancing productivity in Google Workspace applications.

item.title: Updated Chat header helps you navigate chat more quickly and easily
item.description: Google Chat is rolling out an updated header and navigation experience designed to improve user efficiency and accessibility across conversations. This redesign aims to simplify the interface, making it easier for users to find important chats, access features, and manage their communications within Google Workspace.

item.title: Controls for restricting conversation creation in Google Chat available to more organizations
item.description: Google Chat is introducing new administrative controls that allow organizations to restrict who can create new conversations, improving communication governance. This feature provides IT administrators with granular control over chat initiation, helping to maintain order, prevent spam, and ensure relevant communication channels within Google Workspace.

item.title: New to Google Meet: Continue your conversations in Google Chat
item.description: Google is enabling seamless transitions between Google Chat and Google Meet, allowing users to easily continue their text conversations with a video call or vice versa. This integration streamlines communication workflows, facilitating a more natural and efficient shift between different modes of collaboration within Google Workspace.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - October 31, 2025
item.description: This weekly recap for October 31, 2025, covers recent Google Workspace updates including enhanced writing assistance with Gemini in Google Docs, improvements to Google Chat's Workday app integration, and more powerful pivot tables in Google Sheets' Connected Sheets. The summary also touches on enhanced admin audit logs and new presentation generation capabilities via Gemini.

item.title: Improving the Workday Google Chat app
item.description: The Workday app integration within Google Chat is receiving improvements to enhance HR and financial workflows, allowing users to access Workday functionalities directly from Chat. This update aims to streamline common tasks such as time-off requests, expense reporting, and accessing payslips, boosting productivity and collaboration within Google Workspace.

item.title: Improve your writing by grounding Gemini in Google Docs in sources
item.description: Gemini in Google Docs is being enhanced to improve writing by leveraging user-provided sources, allowing the AI to generate text that is more accurate and contextually relevant. This feature empowers users to create higher-quality documents and research papers by grounding Gemini's suggestions in specific, reliable information.

item.title: More powerful pivot tables in Connected Sheets
item.description: Google Sheets' Connected Sheets feature is gaining more powerful pivot table capabilities, enabling users to perform advanced data analysis directly on data sourced from BigQuery and other external databases. This enhancement allows for more complex insights and robust reporting without leaving the familiar Sheets interface, boosting productivity for data analysts.

item.title: October Workspace Drop: New AI-powered storytelling, research, and data protections
item.description: The October Google Workspace drop introduces new AI-powered features focused on storytelling, research, and data protection. Updates include AI-generated video creation in Google Vids, enhanced research capabilities in NotebookLM and Google Search, and advanced data protection measures like client-side encryption for Google Drive and Gmail to bolster security and compliance.

item.title: Enhanced admin audit log events
item.description: Google Workspace administrators are gaining access to enhanced audit log events, providing more detailed insights into user activities and administrative changes across the suite. This improvement strengthens security, compliance monitoring, and incident response capabilities, offering greater transparency and control for IT departments.

item.title: Generate presentations in the Gemini app
item.description: The Gemini app is now capable of generating full presentations from text prompts, allowing users to quickly create professional-looking slideshows. This AI-powered feature streamlines content creation for pitches, reports, and educational materials, significantly reducing the time and effort required to design impactful presentations.

item.title: New LaTeX features in the Gemini app
item.description: The Gemini app is introducing new LaTeX features, enabling users to create and edit complex mathematical equations and scientific notations more easily. This enhancement caters to academic and scientific users, making Gemini a more powerful tool for generating technical documents and research papers with precise formatting.

item.title: Introducing a new waiting rooms experience in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out enhanced waiting rooms, giving meeting hosts greater control over who enters a meeting, with options to admit, deny, or even chat with participants before they join. These new features improve security and privacy for virtual meetings, ensuring only authorized individuals can access sensitive discussions.

item.title: Cultivating an AI-native mindset
item.description: Cultivating an AI-native mindset involves embracing continuous learning and experimentation with generative AI tools to unlock new possibilities and enhance productivity. Organizations like Uber, ATB Financial, and Equifax are leveraging Google Workspace with Gemini to transform workflows, reduce manual tasks, and foster innovative collaboration across their teams.

item.title: How Augustana University is building its future with Google Workspace and NotebookLM
item.description: Augustana University is leveraging Google Workspace, including Google Docs and Google Classroom, along with NotebookLM, to enhance teaching, learning, and administrative efficiency for its 2,500 students and 500 staff.
