NotebookLM, powered by Gemini, allows students and faculty to rapidly synthesize information from vast academic sources, saving significant research time and fostering deeper understanding of complex topics.

item.title: Ask Gemini in Google Meet coming to Workspace enterprise customers
item.description: Gemini is integrating with Google Meet, allowing participants to "Ask Gemini" directly within a meeting for real-time information, summaries, or to answer questions based on the meeting context or broader knowledge. This AI assistant enhances meeting productivity by providing instant insights and reducing the need to switch applications during a call.

item.title: Educators can now convert rubrics in Google Classroom from Drive or local files with help from Gemini
item.description: Educators can now use Gemini to convert rubrics from Google Classroom and Google Drive into various formats, streamlining the assessment and feedback process. This AI-powered tool simplifies grading and helps teachers efficiently adapt rubrics for different assignments or share them across platforms, saving valuable time.

item.title: Use emoji reactions in your client-side encrypted documents
item.description: Google Docs is enabling emoji reactions for client-side encrypted (CSE) documents, allowing users to express themselves without compromising the document's enhanced security. This feature balances strong encryption with collaborative expressiveness, making encrypted documents more interactive while maintaining data privacy standards.

item.title: AI credit overages admin control and related billing
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new administrative controls for AI credit overages, allowing organizations to manage and monitor their spending on AI features like Gemini more effectively. This update provides transparency into usage and billing, helping IT admins control costs associated with advanced AI capabilities within their workspace.

item.title: Protecting Gmail users from XS-Search with Cross-Origin Opener Policy (COOP)
item.description: Google is enhancing Gmail's security to protect users from XS-Search (Cross-Site Search) attacks, which exploit search functionalities to infer sensitive information. This update reinforces user privacy and data security by implementing advanced safeguards against sophisticated web vulnerabilities, ensuring a safer email experience.

item.title: Gemini in Google Sheets can now analyze data across multiple tables
item.description: Gemini is integrating with Google Sheets to provide AI-powered data analysis capabilities, allowing users to ask natural language questions about their data and receive insights or formula suggestions. This enhancement democratizes data analysis, making it easier for users of all skill levels to extract meaningful information and trends from their spreadsheets.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - October 17, 2025
item.description: This weekly recap for October 17, 2025, highlights new features such as AI credit overage controls and billing transparency for admins, enhanced Gmail protection against XS-Search attacks, and Gemini's new data analysis capabilities in Google Sheets. It also mentions the release of Flashcards in Gemini and new business continuity editions for Google Workspace.

item.title: Flashcards in Gemini are now available to users of all ages
item.description: Flashcards are now available within the Gemini app, offering an AI-powered tool for learning and memorization across various subjects. This feature leverages Gemini's capabilities to generate, organize, and present flashcards, enhancing study efficiency for students and professionals alike.

item.title: Introducing Business Continuity editions: Support business continuity and resilience for enterprise customers
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new Business Continuity Editions designed to ensure organizations maintain operations during outages or disasters, offering enhanced resilience and recovery options. These editions provide advanced backup, data replication, and failover capabilities, underscoring Google's commitment to enterprise reliability and data protection.

item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out an update that allows organizations' logos to appear more prominently across various Google services, enhancing brand identity and user experience. item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets is receiving expanded editing capabilities, enabling users to modify and refine AI-generated content or formulas more intuitively. This enhancement allows for greater control and customization over AI suggestions, making Gemini a more flexible and powerful co-editor for complex data manipulation and analysis within spreadsheets.

item.title: August Workspace Drop: Unlock insights and get up to speed quickly with new AI features in Sheets, NotebookLM, and more!
item.description: The August Google Workspace drop introduces significant AI-powered features, including enhanced capabilities in Google Sheets for data analysis and deeper integration of NotebookLM for advanced research. These updates aim to boost productivity by enabling users to automate data insights, summarize extensive documents, and generate content more efficiently across their daily workflows.

item.title: Convert images to video with Veo 3 in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids, powered by Veo 3 AI, now allows users to convert static images into dynamic videos, leveraging advanced AI for motion and storytelling. This feature, rolling out from August 12, 2025, democratizes video creation, enabling users to transform visual assets into engaging multimedia content with ease.

item.title: Gemini in Google Sheets helps you create dynamic and easily referenced tables
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets is enhancing its capabilities to assist users with data analysis, formula generation, and insight extraction using natural language. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature makes complex spreadsheet tasks more accessible and efficient, significantly improving productivity for a wide range of users.

item.title: Deliver your message with AI avatars in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids is introducing AI-generated avatars, allowing users to create personalized virtual presenters for their videos. This feature, rolling out from August 12, 2025, enhances video production by offering customizable, synthetic characters, useful for explainer videos, marketing, and e-learning without needing real actors.

item.title: Edit videos more easily using the transcript in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids is integrating AI-powered transcript-based video editing, allowing users to edit videos by simply editing the generated text transcript. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature simplifies the video editing process, making it more accessible and efficient by transforming text edits into precise video adjustments.

item.title: Supporting our EU customers with their DPIAs: Google's commitment to privacy and security with Google Workspace with Gemini
item.description: Google is providing Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) support for Google Workspace with Gemini, demonstrating its commitment to data privacy and regulatory compliance, particularly for sensitive enterprise data. This initiative helps organizations meet stringent data protection requirements, like GDPR, by outlining how Gemini processes data while ensuring security and privacy within the Workspace environment.

item.title: Adding image support to Gemini in the side panel of Google Drive
item.description: Gemini can now be used on images stored in Google Drive, providing AI-powered analysis, categorization, and editing suggestions for visual content. This integration, rolling out from August 12, 2025, enhances asset management and content creation by allowing users to leverage AI for their image libraries directly within Drive.

item.title: Image editing now available in the Gemini app
item.description: The Gemini app is now offering image editing capabilities, allowing users to modify and enhance images directly within the AI assistant. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature expands Gemini's utility as a comprehensive creative tool, enabling users to perform tasks like resizing, cropping, and applying filters with AI assistance.

item.title: Context-Aware Access policies can now be applied to all internal and third-party apps using OpenID Connect
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing security with Context-Aware Access for OpenID Connect (OIDC) applications, allowing administrators to define granular access policies based on user context. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature strengthens zero-trust security models by ensuring secure access to third-party apps, thereby improving data protection and compliance.

item.title: Let others easily book time with you using the new pre-configured Google Calendar booking page
item.description: Google Calendar is introducing pre-configured appointment booking pages, simplifying the process for users to set up and share their availability for meetings and consultations. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enhances personal and professional scheduling efficiency, making it easier for clients and colleagues to book time.

item.title: Edit your Google Drive videos in your browser, using Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids now allows users to directly edit videos stored in Google Drive, streamlining the video production workflow within the Workspace ecosystem. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enables seamless content creation and collaboration by eliminating the need to download and re-upload video files for editing.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - August 22, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for August 22, 2025, highlights the ability to edit Google Drive videos directly in Google Vids and new pre-configured appointment booking in Google Calendar. It also covers Gemini Live integration with Calendar, Tasks, and Keep, alongside ServiceNow integration with Google Chat and Sheets, showcasing advancements in video editing, scheduling, AI integration, and enterprise tools.

item.title: Effortlessly work with ServiceNow data across Google Chat and Sheets
item.description: ServiceNow is integrating with Google Chat and Google Sheets, enabling seamless workflows between IT service management and Workspace collaboration tools. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this integration allows users to manage service requests, update tickets, and analyze data directly from Chat and Sheets, significantly improving IT efficiency and communication.

item.title: Incorporate information from Calendar, Tasks, and Keep in your conversations with Gemini Live
item.description: Gemini Live is integrating with Google Calendar, Tasks, and Keep, providing real-time AI assistance across scheduling, task management, and note-taking. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enhances personal organization and productivity by offering dynamic AI support for managing daily workflows and information.

item.title: Google Workspace with Gemini allows MERGE to build a more innovative, effective, and creative team
item.description: Merge, a company known for its digital solutions, is leveraging Google Workspace with Gemini to foster an innovative, effective, and creative team environment. Gemini helps Merge employees streamline content creation, summarize information, and enhance collaboration, enabling the team to focus on strategic initiatives and deliver more impactful results across their projects.

item.title: Create and manage student groups using the Google Classroom API
item.description: The Google Classroom API is being updated to allow for the creation and management of student groups, providing educators and developers with programmatic control over class organization. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enhances flexibility for customized learning environments, differentiated instruction, and integration with third-party educational tools.

item.title: Arrow keys now move an object by a pixel distance in Google Slides
item.description: Google Slides is introducing a precision editing feature that allows users to move objects by a single pixel using arrow keys, enhancing design control. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this update significantly improves the ability to fine-tune visual layouts and alignment in presentations, catering to detailed design needs and improving overall presentation quality.

item.title: Catch up on unread messages within a conversation in Google Chat
item.description: Gemini in Google Chat is introducing a feature to help users catch up on unread conversations by providing AI-generated summaries of missed messages. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this functionality improves communication efficiency and reduces information overload by allowing users to quickly grasp the essence of past discussions.

item.title: Improving the ISEMAIL and ISURL functions in Google Sheets
item.description: Google Sheets is improving the accuracy and functionality of its ISMAIL and ISURL functions, enhancing data validation and processing capabilities. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this update helps users more reliably identify and work with email addresses and URLs within their spreadsheets, ensuring cleaner and more accurate data.

item.title: Listen to your documents using Gemini in Google Docs
item.description: Gemini in Google Docs now allows users to listen to documents, leveraging AI-powered text-to-speech technology for enhanced accessibility and review. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enhances productivity by enabling auditory content consumption, offering an alternative way to proofread or process information, especially for mobile users or those with visual impairments.

item.title: Coming soon: A refreshed user interface for Google Meet hardware touch controllers, test it now in preview
item.description: Google Meet hardware touch controllers are receiving an early preview of a refreshed user interface for "Rooms," designed to streamline meeting control and improve usability. Rolling out from July 29, 2025, this update aims to enhance the in-room meeting experience by making it more intuitive and efficient for starting and managing video conferences.

item.title: Increased credit limit for Google AI Ultra for Business users and expanded country availability to Whisk
item.description: Google is increasing the credit limit for its AI Ultra Business offering in "Whisk countries," signaling expanded access to advanced AI capabilities for businesses in specific regions. This initiative aims to foster greater adoption and utilization of AI solutions, supporting innovation and growth for enterprises in these markets.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Recap - August 15, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for August 18, 2025, highlights app access control request approval and the ability to replace or expand image backgrounds in Slides and Vids. It also covers sorting notes in Google Keep for Android, adding events to Gmail and Calendar via Gemini on mobile, and NotebookLM Gems LTI integration, detailing advancements in security, AI visual editing, mobile organization, and educational AI.

item.title: Approval workflow for enterprise users to request access to unconfigured apps
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing app access control by introducing request access approval workflows for third-party applications. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature provides administrators with granular control over which apps can access organizational data, significantly improving security and compliance by preventing unauthorized data exposure.

item.title: New apps for Google Chat make teamwork more fluid and connected
item.description: Google Chat is introducing new apps and integrations designed to improve teamwork and streamline workflows, making it a more powerful collaboration hub within Google Workspace. These updates enable users to connect with essential business tools, automate tasks, and enhance communication, fostering a more efficient and productive team environment.

item.title: Quickly add events to Google Calendar with Gemini in Gmail on mobile
item.description: Gemini on mobile devices now allows users to add events directly to Google Calendar from Gmail, streamlining event creation and scheduling. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature leverages AI to parse email content and intelligently suggest calendar entries, significantly enhancing productivity for mobile users.

item.title: Sorting your notes in Google Keep on Android devices
item.description: Google Keep on Android is introducing new sorting options for notes, allowing users to organize their information more efficiently. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this update enhances personal organization and productivity by providing flexible ways to arrange notes, such as by date, title, or custom order.

item.title: Adding AI image editing features to Google Slides and Google Vids
item.description: Google Slides and Google Vids are integrating AI-powered features to replace and expand image backgrounds, allowing for creative visual adjustments. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature simplifies complex image manipulation tasks, enabling users to quickly customize visuals for presentations and videos without requiring advanced graphic design skills.

item.title: Adding NotebookLM and Gems to Gemini Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI™)
item.description: NotebookLM Gems are integrating into the Gemini LTI (Learning Tools Interoperability) framework, allowing educators to seamlessly incorporate NotebookLM's AI-powered learning modules into their Learning Management Systems. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature expands the reach of NotebookLM's tools, providing more personalized and interactive learning experiences through existing educational platforms.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Docs to generate images on Android devices
item.description: Gemini in Google Docs on Android is gaining the ability to generate images directly from text prompts, allowing users to create visual content within their documents. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature enhances mobile document creation and visual storytelling by integrating AI-powered image generation, significantly boosting creativity and efficiency.

item.title: Granular OAuth consent in Google Apps Editor Add-ons
item.description: Google apps are introducing granular OAuth consent, allowing users to grant more specific permissions to third-party applications when linking their Google accounts. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this enhancement improves user privacy and security by providing finer control over data access, significantly reducing the risk of over-privileged app permissions.

item.title: Full screen for screen sharing
item.description: Google Meet is introducing an enhanced full-screen experience, optimizing the display for video calls and content sharing. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this update aims to improve user focus and engagement during meetings by maximizing screen real estate and minimizing distractions, thereby enhancing the overall virtual meeting environment.

item.title: Deploy Context-Aware Access levels in “Warn” mode
item.description: Google Workspace's Context-Aware Access is introducing a "warn mode" that alerts users when their access conditions are not met, rather than outright blocking them. Rolling out from August 12, 2025, this feature offers a more flexible approach to security policy enforcement, informing users about non-compliance while potentially allowing temporary access, aiding policy adoption and troubleshooting.

item.title: Transforming HR workflows with AI
item.description: Turing, a global talent platform, is transforming its HR workflows through the strategic implementation of AI, streamlining recruitment and talent management processes. By leveraging AI to automate candidate sourcing, screening, and onboarding, Turing significantly reduces manual effort, improves efficiency, and enhances the overall employee experience within their operations, complementing tools like Google Workspace.

item.title: Receive more in-depth responses from Gemini in Google Drive on PDF queries
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is being enhanced to support larger PDFs and longer contexts, allowing users to interact with documents up to 2 million words or approximately 3,000 pages for summarization, questions, and extracting information. This capability is rolling out to users with Gemini for Google Workspace or the Gemini Business and Enterprise add-ons, significantly improving information retrieval from extensive documents.

item.title: Google Meet logs will now show encryption type for call endpoints
item.description: Google Workspace will enhance audit logs for Google Meet by adding encryption type details for client-side encrypted (CSE) meetings, providing greater transparency and control for administrators. This update, rolling out starting August 19, 2025, will show whether a meeting uses Google-managed or external encryption keys via the Admin console and Reports API.

item.title: Use Gemini to create illustrated storybooks
item.description: Google is introducing an Illustrated Storybook feature powered by Gemini in Google Workspace, allowing users to generate and personalize audio-visual storybooks from text prompts. Available to Gemini for Google Workspace users and those with the Gemini add-on, this feature supports various styles and allows users to export stories to Google Docs or as MP4 video files, rolling out to Rapid Release domains from August 19, 2025.

item.title: Language expansion for “suggested next steps” when using “Take Notes for Me”
item.description: Google Meet's "Take notes for me" feature, powered by Gemini, is expanding its language support to include French, German, Japanese, Portuguese, and Spanish, in addition to English, for summarizing meetings and suggesting next steps. This enhancement will also support the summarization of client-side encrypted meetings, aiming to boost productivity for a broader global user base.

item.title: New study tools in the Gemini app to help you learn more effectively
item.description: Gemini is integrating new study tools into Google Workspace, allowing students to generate quizzes, study guides, and flashcards directly from Google Docs, Google Slides, and PDFs. This feature, available for Gemini for Google Workspace Education upgrades and the Gemini add-on, aims to enhance learning and preparation for exams by making study material creation more efficient.

item.title: Ask Gemini in Google Forms to suggest new questions
item.description: Gemini in Google Forms is being updated to allow users to generate more targeted and relevant follow-up questions for existing forms or new forms based on specific topics. This feature, available to those with a Gemini for Google Workspace add-on, aims to improve survey design and data collection efficiency by leveraging AI suggestions.

item.title: Upcoming changes to reboot, alert, and log settings for Google Meet hardware devices
item.description: Google Meet Hardware is receiving updates to enhance manageability and monitoring, including a new setting to schedule reboots at specific times, an alert log for device issues, and time zone settings that sync with the Admin console. These improvements aim to simplify device management and ensure optimal performance for Google Meet rooms.

item.title: Automatic Room Check-in in Google Meet with Proximity Detection
item.description: Google Meet is introducing automatic room check-in for Google Meet Hardware devices, utilizing ultrasonic signals to detect user presence and confirm meeting attendance. This feature aims to improve room utilization data and prevent abandoned meetings, automatically ending a meeting or releasing the room if no one checks in.

item.title: Export Gemini Audit logs to BigQuery
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now export Gemini audit logs to BigQuery, providing enhanced capabilities for security investigations, compliance, and custom reporting on Gemini usage. This feature, available for Gemini for Google Workspace customers, allows for more granular analysis of AI interactions within the organization.

item.title: NotebookLM is now available to all education users
item.description: NotebookLM, an AI-powered note-taking and research assistant, is now generally available to all Google Workspace users globally, expanding beyond its initial beta for Education customers. This tool allows users to upload documents, PDFs, and Google Slides to generate summaries, outlines, and ask questions, enhancing productivity and knowledge management.

item.title: Introducing enhanced interoperability between Google Chat and Microsoft Teams — powered by NextPlane
item.description: Google Chat is introducing enhanced interoperability features, allowing users to chat directly with individuals on external messaging platforms like Microsoft Teams, Slack, and Zoom Team Chat within the Google Chat interface. This aims to streamline communication and reduce context switching by integrating with other popular platforms.

item.title: Build and deploy a single app across Chat, Gmail, Calendar, Drive and more with the Workspace add-ons framework
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out the capability for developers to build and deploy a single application that functions seamlessly across Google Chat, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. This new framework aims to streamline development and enhance app functionality within the Google Workspace ecosystem, reducing redundant development efforts for multi-platform integrations.

item.title: Train multiple models for AI classification for Google Drive on demand
item.description: Google Drive's AI classification for data loss prevention (DLP) is being enhanced with multi-model support, allowing administrators to select different AI models for improved classification accuracy, and on-demand model training for custom data sets. This update provides more granular control and better precision in identifying and protecting sensitive information within Google Drive.

item.title: Google Workspace named a Leader in Forrester Wave UCaaS 2025 Report
item.description: Google Workspace has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS), Q1 2025 report, highlighting its strong offerings in collaboration, communication, and AI integration. This recognition solidifies Google Workspace's position as a top choice for enterprises seeking comprehensive, AI-powered solutions to enhance productivity and teamwork.

item.title: Defending against account takeovers from today’s top threats with passkeys and DBSC
item.description: Google is bolstering defenses against account takeovers, a top cybersecurity threat, by promoting the adoption of passkeys and device-bound session cookies (DBSC). These advanced authentication methods significantly reduce reliance on passwords, offering stronger protection against phishing and credential stuffing attacks across Google Workspace and other Google services, enhancing overall user security.

item.title: Introducing Video Overviews and upgrades to the Studio panel in NotebookLM
item.description: NotebookLM is introducing new features including Video Overviews that summarize key topics from YouTube videos, and an updated Studio panel for organizing sources, notes, and generated content. These enhancements aim to streamline research workflows, making it easier to digest video content and manage information within the AI-powered note-taking application.

item.title: Audit log changes for select Google Meet hardware settings
item.description: Google Workspace is updating audit logs for several Google products, including Google Groups, Classroom, and Cloud Search, to provide more detailed events and improved visibility for administrators. These enhancements aim to strengthen security, compliance, and administrative oversight across various services within the Google Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Increased limits to Gemini 2.5 Pro for Gemini for Education users, free of charge
item.description: Google is increasing the rate limits for Gemini 1.5 Pro within Google Workspace to 60 queries per minute (QPM), up from 25 QPM, and introducing additional capacity for concurrent calls to the API. This enhancement aims to support more intensive AI workloads and improve performance for developers utilizing Gemini in their applications.

item.title: Questrade Financial Group transforms productivity using Google Workspace with Gemini
item.description: Questrade Financial Group, a leading online brokerage, is transforming productivity by integrating Gemini into Google Workspace, enabling its employees to enhance efficiency across various operations. Gemini helps Questrade streamline content creation, summarize complex financial documents, and improve communication, allowing teams to focus more on strategic initiatives and client service within a regulated financial environment.

item.title: Because you asked: Our top 10 Workspace productivity tips
item.description: This article shares the top 10 productivity tips for maximizing Google Workspace, focusing on features that streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and improve time management. Tips include leveraging smart canvases, utilizing focus time in Calendar, mastering keyboard shortcuts, and organizing files efficiently in Google Drive to boost individual and team efficiency.

item.title: July Workspace feature drop: Create videos with Veo 3 in the Gemini app, summarize videos with Gemini in Drive, and more
item.description: The July Google Workspace feature drop introduces significant enhancements, including advanced capabilities for Google Veo 3 for creative content generation and AI-powered video summaries in Google Drive. These updates aim to boost productivity and collaboration by enabling users to quickly grasp video content and efficiently create high-quality visual assets, leveraging generative AI.

item.title: Thumbnail previews will now show on video progress bar in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is enhancing its video playback experience with thumbnail previews that indicate video progress when hovering over the seek bar, similar to YouTube. This feature allows users to quickly navigate to specific points in a video, improving efficiency for reviewing and accessing content stored in Drive.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - July 18, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for July 18, 2025, highlight new features including the general availability of enhanced Google Chat interoperability with external platforms and Google Drive's AI classification updates with multi-model support. Other updates cover improved audit logs for Google Groups and Classroom, and increased Gemini 1.5 Pro rate limits for developers.

item.title: Designing self-guided learning for your career with generative AI
item.description: Google offers strategies for designing self-guided learning paths using AI, particularly focusing on how Gemini can aid in career development and skill acquisition. By leveraging Gemini to summarize complex information, generate personalized learning materials, and provide tailored feedback, individuals can efficiently acquire new knowledge and adapt to evolving job market demands, enhancing professional growth.

item.title: Enterprise security controls for Google Workspace with Gemini
item.description: Google is implementing robust enterprise security controls for Google Workspace with Gemini, addressing critical concerns around data privacy, governance, and compliance for businesses. These controls include data residency options, access management, and enhanced logging capabilities, ensuring that AI-powered functionalities can be adopted securely within regulated environments.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Docs on iOS devices in 20+ languages
item.description: Gemini is now available in Google Docs on iOS devices, allowing users to leverage AI capabilities like drafting, summarizing, and brainstorming directly within the Docs mobile app. This expansion brings enhanced productivity features to a wider range of mobile users, accessible to those with the Gemini add-on for Google Workspace.

item.title: Now generally available: extract and categorize data in AppSheet with the power of Gemini
item.description: AppSheet's "Extract and Categorize with Gemini" feature is now generally available, enabling users to automatically extract and categorize unstructured data from various sources using AI. This capability, powered by Gemini, streamlines data processing and organization within AppSheet applications, enhancing automation and efficiency for businesses.

item.title: Link your Google Calendar booking pages when composing emails in Gmail
item.description: Google Calendar booking pages can now be easily linked directly from Gmail, allowing users to share their availability for meetings more efficiently via email. This integration aims to streamline scheduling processes, making it simpler for recipients to book appointments without leaving their inbox.

item.title: Now Generally Available: Migrate files from Microsoft SharePoint Online to Google Drive
item.description: The migration tool for moving Microsoft SharePoint Online content to Google Workspace is now generally available, enabling organizations to seamlessly transfer files and data. This full rollout follows a successful open beta, facilitating a smoother transition for enterprises looking to consolidate their cloud storage and collaboration platforms.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - July 11, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for July 11, 2025, announce the general availability of the Microsoft SharePoint Online migration tool to Google Workspace and the 'Extract and Categorize with Gemini' feature in AppSheet. Other updates include Gemini's availability in Google Docs on iOS and the ability to link Google Calendar booking pages in Gmail.

item.title: How-to guide: Achieving digital sovereignty with Google Workspace
item.description: Google Workspace is enabling organizations to achieve digital sovereignty through robust data residency options, transparent security controls, and adherence to local regulations, particularly crucial for public sector and highly regulated industries. This commitment ensures that data processing and storage comply with national requirements, providing customers with greater control and confidence over their digital assets and operations.

item.title: Introducing Lucidchart and Lucidspark apps in Google Chat
item.description: Lucidchart and Lucidspark have launched new Google Chat apps, allowing users to receive notifications and share diagrams, whiteboards, and visual content directly within Google Chat. This integration aims to enhance real-time collaboration and streamline workflows for visual communication within Google Workspace.

item.title: Beyond the prompt: Resources to get started with Workspace with Gemini today
item.description: Google offers comprehensive resources to help users move 'beyond the prompt' and master advanced techniques for leveraging Gemini's full potential within Google Workspace. These resources include guides on prompt engineering, best practices for integrating AI into workflows, and case studies highlighting how Gemini enhances productivity and creativity for various tasks, from drafting emails to analyzing data.

item.title: Manage email subscriptions from a single location in Gmail
item.description: Gmail is introducing improved controls for managing email subscriptions directly within the inbox, allowing users to easily unsubscribe from mailing lists with enhanced tools. This feature aims to help users reduce inbox clutter and manage their email preferences more efficiently.

item.title: Drive IRM Update: More Control for File Owners and Shared Drive Managers
item.description: Google Drive is introducing more granular Information Rights Management (IRM) controls for file owners and Shared Drive managers, allowing them to restrict download, print, and copy options for specific users or groups. This enhancement provides greater control over sensitive data and improves data security within Google Drive.

item.title: Search for embedded content in Google Sites
item.description: Google Sites is enhancing its search capabilities to include embedded content, allowing users to find information within embedded Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and other files. This update improves discoverability and efficiency when searching for specific information within a Google Site.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Drive to execute basic organizational tasks
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is being enhanced to execute basic organizational tasks, such as finding, categorizing, and summarizing files, through natural language prompts. This AI-powered capability aims to boost user productivity and streamline file management by simplifying complex operations within Drive.

item.title: Improved email notifications following Google Meet calls, plus new sharing controls for meeting hosts
item.description: Google Meet's "Take notes for me" feature is receiving improvements, including clearer email notifications for meeting summaries and enhanced host controls over who receives them. This update aims to provide more streamlined information sharing and better management of meeting follow-ups.

item.title: Google Drive Events API now available in Developer Public Preview
item.description: The Google Drive Events API is now generally available, allowing developers to programmatically access and monitor changes to files and folders in Google Drive in real-time. This API enhances integrations with third-party applications and enables more sophisticated automation and data synchronization workflows.

item.title: Gems are now available in the side panel of Google Workspace apps
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing "Gems" in the side panel of various apps, providing quick access to generative AI capabilities powered by Gemini directly within the user's workflow. This integration allows users to leverage AI for drafting, summarizing, and brainstorming without leaving their current Google Docs, Sheets, or Slides documents.

item.title: AppSheet Updates: New Licenses page in the AppSheet Admin Console and group based license controls for Enterprise Plus licenses
item.description: AppSheet is rolling out updates to its license management within the Google Workspace Admin console, providing administrators with more granular control and visibility over user licenses. These improvements aim to simplify the assignment and monitoring of AppSheet licenses across an organization.

item.title: Join a client-side encrypted meeting from a Google Meet Hardware device
item.description: Google Meet Hardware devices can now join client-side encrypted (CSE) meetings, ensuring enhanced security and privacy for sensitive discussions. This feature extends end-to-end encryption to hardware-based meeting rooms, improving compliance and data protection for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus customers.

item.title: Live stream viewers can now send chat messages, plus additional host controls
item.description: Google Meet live stream viewers can now send chat messages during events, enhancing interaction, and hosts gain more controls over live stream participants and chat functionality. These updates aim to create a more engaging and manageable experience for large-scale presentations and webinars.

item.title: Because you asked: Achieving more with Google Workspace
item.description: This article provides practical tips for achieving more with Google Workspace, focusing on optimizing daily workflows and leveraging built-in collaboration features. Strategies include utilizing Google Calendar for efficient scheduling, organizing files in Google Drive, enhancing communication with Google Chat, and employing Smart Canvas to streamline document creation and teamwork.

item.title: Improving Google Meet hardware admin log events with more granular information
item.description: Google Meet Hardware is receiving improvements to its admin log events, providing more detailed information for troubleshooting and monitoring device health and usage. This enhancement allows administrators to more effectively manage and diagnose issues with their Google Meet room systems.

item.title: Access Gemini Audit logs using the Reporting API, the security and audit investigation tools
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out Gemini audit logs and a new Reporting API, providing administrators with detailed insights into AI interactions and user activity for security and compliance purposes. These tools allow organizations to monitor how Gemini is being used, aiding in investigations and maintaining data governance standards.

item.title: Google Workspace: Enabling FINRA compliance and enhanced capabilities for Financial Services organizations
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing its capabilities to enable FINRA compliance for financial services firms, addressing stringent regulatory requirements for data retention, e-discovery, and secure communication. New features and integrations are designed to help organizations meet industry standards while leveraging Google Workspace's collaborative and AI-powered tools, like Gemini, for increased productivity and efficiency.

item.title: Google Vids is now available for all Google Workspace for Education customers
item.description: Google Vids, an AI-powered video creation app, is now available for Google Workspace for Education customers, allowing educators and students to easily create engaging videos. This tool leverages AI to streamline video production, making it accessible for educational content and presentations.

item.title: Gemini in Google Classroom is now available to all Google Workspace for Education editions, with added features
item.description: Gemini is now available in Google Classroom for all Google Workspace for Education editions, including Fundamentals, Standard, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Plus. This integration brings AI capabilities to help educators with tasks like generating assignments and providing feedback, enhancing teaching and learning experiences.

item.title: FINRA Compliance for Google Workspace: Google Drive and Calendar Updates
item.description: Google Workspace has achieved FINRA compliance for Google Drive and Google Calendar, making these services suitable for financial institutions requiring strict regulatory adherence. This certification ensures that data handling and record-keeping meet the high standards set by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority.

item.title: Hardware Key Certificate Management for client-side encryption in Gmail
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing Hardware Key and Certificate Management for Client-Side Encryption (CSE) in Gmail, allowing organizations to integrate their existing hardware security modules (HSMs) for managing encryption keys. This provides enhanced security and control over sensitive email data, meeting stringent compliance requirements for enterprise and government clients.

item.title: Now generally available: prevent sensitive changes by locking Google Groups
item.description: Locked Google Groups, which prevent members from leaving, are now generally available, providing administrators with more control over group memberships for critical communications. This feature is particularly useful for ensuring mandatory participation in groups for compliance, security, or essential information dissemination within organizations.

item.title: Introducing more granular controls for multi-party approvals for sensitive admin actions
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing more granular controls for multi-party approvals on sensitive admin actions, allowing organizations to customize approval workflows for critical changes. This enhancement provides an additional layer of security and oversight, ensuring that high-impact administrative tasks require multiple authorizations.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 27, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 27, 2025, announce the general availability of locked Google Groups and hardware key certificate management for Gmail's client-side encryption. Other updates include FINRA compliance for Google Drive and Calendar, and the availability of Google Vids and Gemini in Google Classroom for Education customers.

item.title: Push what’s possible with Google AI Ultra for Business
item.description: Google AI Ultra for Business is introduced as a premium tier of Gemini, designed to provide advanced generative AI capabilities tailored for enterprise use cases within Google Workspace. This offering delivers enhanced performance, greater context windows, and robust security features, empowering businesses to tackle complex tasks like advanced data analysis, sophisticated content generation, and intricate workflow automation.

item.title: Introducing Google AI Ultra for Business: Providing Access to Advanced AI Features and Next-Gen tools
item.description: Google AI Ultra is being introduced for business users, offering advanced AI capabilities for enhanced productivity and problem-solving across various Google Workspace applications. This premium AI model is designed to handle more complex tasks, generate higher-quality content, and provide deeper insights for enterprise clients.

item.title: June Workspace feature drop: Create with Veo 3 in Google Vids and connect the Gemini app with your Google Workspace apps and more
item.description: The June Google Workspace drop introduces significant advancements, including new capabilities for creating content with Google Veo 3 and new features within Google Vids for video editing. Additionally, the Gemini app receives updates to enhance connectivity and collaboration, further integrating AI-powered assistance across Google Workspace applications for improved productivity and creative output.

item.title: See summaries of even more file types directly in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is expanding its capability to provide AI-powered summaries of more shared file types, allowing users to quickly grasp the content of attached documents without opening them. This feature, leveraging Gemini, enhances productivity by making information more accessible within chat conversations.

item.title: Generate data with Gemini in Google Sheets
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets now allows users to generate data, such as sample datasets or placeholder information, directly within their spreadsheets using natural language prompts. This feature, available for Gemini for Google Workspace users, streamlines data entry and content creation for analysis and prototyping.

item.title: Gemini Add-ons will no longer appear under subscriptions in the Admin console for Workspace Business and Enterprise customers
item.description: Google Workspace is updating the Admin console's Subscriptions page to provide more detailed information and easier management for Gemini add-ons. This improvement allows administrators to better track and control Gemini licenses and features across their organization.

item.title: Updates to the GitHub app for Google Chat
item.description: The GitHub App for Google Chat is receiving updates to improve integration and notification capabilities, allowing developers to receive more relevant alerts and collaborate on code changes directly within Google Chat. This enhancement aims to streamline development workflows and foster better team communication.

item.title: Equifax embraces secure generative AI with Gemini
item.description: Equifax, a global data, analytics, and technology company, is embracing Gemini for secure innovation across its business units, leveraging its capabilities within Google Workspace. Gemini helps Equifax enhance productivity, streamline data analysis, and accelerate report generation while maintaining stringent security and compliance standards, critical for the financial services industry.

item.title: Adding granular control options for who can respond to existing Google Forms
item.description: Google Forms is introducing more granular controls for existing forms, allowing creators to manage permissions and settings with greater precision. This update enhances security and administrative oversight, ensuring that forms are distributed and accessed according to specific organizational needs.

item.title: Changes to "Who can manage" and "Who can view" members in Google Groups starting September 15, 2025
item.description: Google Groups is introducing upcoming changes to how custom roles are managed, offering more precise controls over who can manage and view specific roles within a group. This update aims to enhance administrative flexibility and security for complex group structures.

item.title: Google Classroom now supports exporting grades and importing data with STLink SIS
item.description: Google Classroom is enhancing its interoperability by allowing easier exporting of grades and importing of data from Student Information Systems (SIS) like STLink. This integration streamlines grade management and data synchronization for educators, reducing manual entry and improving accuracy.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 20, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 20, 2025, detail updates including more granular controls for multi-party approvals in admin actions and the rollout of Google AI Ultra for business users. Other highlights cover improved Gemini add-on management in the Admin console, updates to the GitHub App for Google Chat, and expanded AI summaries for shared files in Google Chat.

item.title: The Gemini app is now available to all education users
item.description: The Gemini app is now available for all Google Workspace for Education users across all editions, providing advanced AI capabilities for drafting, summarizing, and brainstorming directly within their workflow. This wide rollout aims to empower educators and students with generative AI tools to enhance learning and productivity.

item.title: Generate charts and valuable insights using Gemini in Google Sheets in additional languages
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets is expanding its language support, allowing users to generate charts and insights from data using natural language prompts in additional languages beyond English. This enhancement aims to make data analysis and visualization more accessible to a global user base.

item.title: Data migration log events are available in the Admin console
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new data migration log events in the Admin console, providing administrators with detailed visibility into the progress and status of data transfers. These logs aim to improve monitoring and troubleshooting for IT teams managing large-scale migrations to Google Workspace.

item.title: Create a Google Vid from Google Slides
item.description: Google Vids, the AI-powered video creation app, now allows users to directly create videos from Google Slides presentations, leveraging AI to transform static content into dynamic visual narratives. This feature streamlines the production of educational and business videos, making it easier to repurpose existing materials.

item.title: Google Meet now offers customizable caption styling
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out customizable caption styling, allowing users to adjust the font size, color, and background of live captions to suit their preferences. This accessibility improvement enhances the meeting experience for individuals with diverse visual needs and preferences.

item.title: Adding new admin settings to control Google Form responses
item.description: Google Forms is introducing new admin settings to give organizations more control over how responses are collected and managed, including options for submission limits and data retention. These enhancements improve data governance and compliance capabilities for Google Forms usage within an enterprise.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 13, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 13, 2025, highlight the availability of the Gemini app for all Google Workspace for Education users and expanded language support for Gemini in Google Sheets for chart generation. Other updates include new data migration log events in the Admin console, the ability to create Google Vids from Google Slides, and customizable caption styling for Google Meet.

item.title: Introducing the Comeen Workplace AI Agent for the Comeen Google Chat app
item.description: Comeen, a workplace experience platform, has launched an AI Agent Google Chat app that helps users manage their office environment, such as booking meeting rooms or finding desks, through natural language commands. This integration streamlines workplace operations and enhances employee productivity via an AI-powered assistant.

item.title: Join a meeting using “companion mode” from Android and iOS tablets
item.description: Google Meet's Companion Mode is expanding to Android and iOS devices, allowing users to access interactive features like polls, Q&A, and hand raising from their mobile devices while in a meeting room. This mobile integration enhances hybrid meeting experiences by providing all participants with equal engagement opportunities.

item.title: 4 ways Gemini in Google Sheets helps small businesses get insights faster
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets offers small businesses four key ways to gain insights faster: automating data organization, generating complex formulas, summarizing data sets, and creating insightful charts. This integration empowers small business owners to streamline financial analysis, inventory management, and customer data reporting, leading to more informed decisions and increased efficiency without requiring extensive data science expertise.

item.title: New host management control for who can ask to join a meeting
item.description: Google Meet is introducing improved host management controls for handling 'ask to join' requests, allowing hosts to more efficiently manage who enters their meetings. This update provides greater security and control over meeting access, reducing disruptions and enhancing meeting integrity.

item.title: Introducing PDF summary cards in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing AI-powered PDF summary cards, providing quick overviews of PDF content without requiring users to open the full document. This feature, leveraging Gemini, enhances productivity by allowing users to rapidly assess the relevance and key takeaways of documents, rolling out to Gemini for Google Workspace customers.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Forms to quickly create a new form
item.description: Google Forms is introducing a "Help me create" feature powered by Gemini, allowing users to generate new forms, question types, and survey content using natural language prompts. This AI-driven tool streamlines the form creation process, making it easier and faster to design effective surveys and data collection instruments.

item.title: Beyond the prompt: Mastering the “deep end” with generative AI
item.description: Mastering the 'deep end' of generative AI requires understanding advanced prompt engineering techniques, iterative refinement, and strategic application of models like Gemini across complex workflows. Google provides guidance for users to move beyond basic prompts, enabling them to harness generative AI for sophisticated tasks such as multi-modal content creation, complex problem-solving, and in-depth research within Google Workspace.

item.title: Migrate email and calendar content from Microsoft Exchange Online to Google Workspace
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out a new migration tool that allows organizations to seamlessly transfer email and calendar content from Microsoft Exchange Online to Google Workspace. This tool aims to simplify the transition process for businesses moving from Microsoft's ecosystem to Google's cloud collaboration platform.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Forms to summarize form responses
item.description: Gemini in Google Forms is being enhanced to summarize survey responses, providing quick insights and key themes from collected data. This AI-powered analysis tool helps users efficiently understand feedback and make data-driven decisions without manually sifting through numerous responses.

item.title: Generate video clips with sound using Veo 3 in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids is being enhanced with the ability to generate video clips complete with sound, leveraging the Veo3 AI model, allowing users to create more dynamic and engaging videos. This feature further automates and enriches the video production process for users creating content for business or education.

item.title: Audit reports for data regions are now available in the Admin console
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new policy compliance log events related to data regions, providing administrators with detailed audit trails for data residency adherence. These logs offer transparency and accountability, crucial for organizations operating under strict regulatory frameworks.

item.title: New class analytics and insights for educators in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Classroom is introducing new class analytics and insights tools to help educators monitor student engagement, performance, and assignment completion. These features provide valuable data to inform teaching strategies and support student success, rolling out to Google Workspace for Education customers.

item.title: Generate fully editable charts using Gemini in Google Sheets
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets now generates fully editable charts, allowing users to customize AI-created visualizations directly within their spreadsheets. This feature provides flexibility and control, making it easier to refine and tailor data representations generated by AI.

item.title: Data regions support for Gemini features in Google Workspace is now available
item.description: Google Workspace is extending data regions support to Gemini features, allowing organizations to specify where their AI-processed data is stored and processed. This enhancement provides greater control over data residency, helping businesses meet compliance requirements and data sovereignty mandates.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Docs on Android devices in 20+ languages
item.description: Gemini is now available in Google Docs on Android devices, enabling users to leverage AI for tasks like drafting, summarizing, and brainstorming directly within the mobile app. This rollout extends powerful generative AI capabilities to Android users, enhancing mobile productivity for Google Workspace subscribers.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 6, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 6, 2025, announce the expansion of Companion Mode to Android and iOS for Google Meet and enhanced host controls for joining requests. Other updates include AI-powered PDF summary cards in Google Drive, the "Help me create" and "Summarize responses" features in Google Forms, and new migration tools for Microsoft Exchange Online content.

item.title: How project managers can become AI trailblazers
item.description: Project managers can become AI trailblazers by integrating generative AI tools, such as Gemini within Google Workspace, to enhance planning, execution, and communication. AI can assist with drafting project plans, summarizing status reports in Google Docs, managing risks, and automating routine tasks, allowing project managers to focus on strategic oversight and team leadership, thereby improving project outcomes and efficiency.

item.title: Infoxchange crafts tailored educational resources in hours instead of days with NotebookLM
item.description: Infoxchange, a non-profit technology provider, is significantly accelerating the creation of educational resources by using NotebookLM, powered by Gemini, within Google Workspace. This AI-powered research assistant enables Infoxchange to synthesize information and draft content in hours instead of days, drastically improving efficiency in developing digital literacy training for disadvantaged communities in Australia.

item.title: Upload code folders or import your GitHub repositories directly into the Gemini app
item.description: Gemini now allows users to upload entire code folders and link GitHub repositories as context for AI interactions, enhancing its capabilities for developers and coders. This feature streamlines code analysis, debugging, and generation by providing Gemini with comprehensive project understanding.

item.title: Present content from camera in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is introducing the ability to present content directly from a camera, allowing users to share physical objects, whiteboards, or documents more easily during video calls. This feature enhances versatility for presentations and interactive discussions in both educational and professional settings.

item.title: Google Meet and Cisco Webex interoperability now includes presented content via a wired HDMI connection
item.description: Google Meet is improving interoperability with Cisco Webex, allowing users to present content via a wired HDMI connection from Google Meet Hardware to Webex meetings. This enhancement simplifies hybrid meeting setups, enabling seamless sharing of content across different video conferencing platforms.

item.title: Use suggestions in your client-side encrypted Google Docs
item.description: Google Docs now supports the use of editing suggestions in client-side encrypted (CSE) documents, enabling collaborative feedback and revisions while maintaining enhanced data security. This feature, available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus customers, ensures sensitive content can be worked on securely and cooperatively.

item.title: Stay up to date on the latest changes to your files in Drive using “Catch me up”
item.description: Google Drive is introducing a new "Catch me up" feature, powered by Gemini, that provides AI-generated summaries of recent activity and changes within a document or shared folder. This tool helps users quickly get up to speed on collaborative projects, improving productivity and information recall.

item.title: Integrate Jira with Gmail to create, update, and track work items directly in your inbox
item.description: The Jira and Confluence apps are now integrated with Gmail, allowing users to receive notifications and interact with tasks and documents directly from their inbox. This integration streamlines workflows for project management and collaboration, reducing context switching for users of both Atlassian and Google services.

item.title: Preview summaries in the Google Chat home view with the help of Gemini in four additional languages
item.description: Google Chat's Gemini-powered summaries are now available in four new languages: French, German, Japanese, and Spanish, in addition to English. This expansion allows a broader international user base to quickly grasp the essence of lengthy chat conversations and shared documents, enhancing global collaboration and productivity.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 30, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 30, 2025, announce the ability to present content from a camera in Google Meet and support for suggestions in client-side encrypted Google Docs. Other updates include Gemini's capability to upload code folders and GitHub repositories, improved Google Meet and Cisco Webex interoperability, and the "Catch me up" feature in Google Drive.

item.title: Democratizing app development using AppSheet with Gemini
item.description: Google is democratizing app development by integrating Gemini into AppSheet, its no-code development platform, empowering citizen developers to create powerful applications with greater ease and speed. This AI integration allows users to build custom apps by simply describing their needs in natural language, automating complex logic and data connections to enhance business processes across Google Workspace.

item.title: New Gemini summary cards now available in the Gmail app on Android and iOS devices
item.description: Gemini-powered summary cards are coming to the Gmail app, providing users with quick, AI-generated overviews of lengthy email threads without needing to open each message. This feature aims to boost mobile productivity by allowing users to rapidly triage and process their inbox content.

item.title: May Workspace feature drop: New AI features for better collaboration and research, plus NotebookLM Mind Maps
item.description: The May Google Workspace feature drop introduces a suite of new AI capabilities, enhancing productivity across applications like Gmail, Docs, and Slides. These updates include advanced drafting features, intelligent summaries, and improved content generation with Gemini, designed to streamline workflows and foster creativity for users in their daily tasks.

item.title: Configure Calendar interoperability with Microsoft Office 365 using the Microsoft Graph API
item.description: Google Calendar is improving interoperability with Microsoft Office 365 calendars using the Microsoft Graph API, allowing for more seamless scheduling and presence updates between the two platforms. This enhancement simplifies cross-organizational collaboration and meeting coordination for mixed IT environments.

item.title: Understand your videos much faster using Gemini in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is integrating Gemini to help users understand videos by providing AI-powered summaries, key topics, and answer questions directly from video content stored in Drive. This feature transforms video files into more interactive and searchable assets, significantly boosting productivity for content review and analysis.

item.title: Introducing video engagement insights in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing video engagement insights for videos stored on the platform, providing creators with data on viewer behavior, such as watch times and popular segments. This feature helps content creators understand audience engagement and optimize their video content strategies.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 23, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 23, 2025, announce Gemini summaries in Google Chat available in four new languages and Gemini summary cards in the Gmail app. Other updates include improved Google Calendar interoperability with Microsoft Office 365, Gemini's ability to understand videos in Google Drive, and new video engagement insights for Google Drive.

item.description: This article offers practical tips for 'spring cleaning' Google Calendar and overall Google Workspace to enhance productivity and reduce digital clutter. Recommendations include decluttering old events, utilizing focus time, streamlining notification settings, and regularly reviewing shared calendars to optimize scheduling and improve time management for a more efficient workday.

item.description: Gemini at I/O 2025 received deep research updates, showcasing enhanced capabilities for complex information synthesis and multi-modal understanding, improving its ability to conduct thorough research and provide comprehensive answers. These advancements position Gemini as a more powerful AI assistant for knowledge workers and researchers across Google Workspace.

item.title: Available in Open Beta: Migrate files from Microsoft SharePoint Online to Google Drive
item.description: Google Workspace announced the open beta for migrating Microsoft SharePoint Online content to Google Workspace, offering organizations a streamlined tool for transferring files and data. This initiative aims to simplify transitions for enterprises consolidating their cloud infrastructure and collaboration tools.

item.title: New ways Workspace with Gemini helps you do your best work — every day
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new features and enhancements, particularly with Gemini integration, designed to empower users to do their best work through advanced AI assistance. These updates streamline tasks like drafting documents in Google Docs, analyzing data in Google Sheets, and generating presentations in Google Slides, enabling users to focus on higher-value activities and foster greater creativity.

item.title: More ways to create with Canvas
item.description: Google Workspace is expanding integration with Canvas LMS, enabling more ways to create content using Gemini, such as generating assignment prompts, discussion topics, and rubrics. This collaboration enhances the capabilities of educational tools by infusing AI-powered assistance directly into learning workflows.

item.title: Personalize learning with Quizzes, available through Canvas in the Gemini app
item.description: Gemini is integrating with Canvas to generate quizzes, allowing educators to quickly create assessments from course materials. This AI-powered feature aims to streamline content creation for learning management systems, enhancing productivity for teachers and providing diverse assessment options.

item.title: Use Google Classroom in even more languages
item.description: Google Classroom is expanding its language support to include even more languages, making the platform accessible to a wider global audience of educators and students. This update aims to foster inclusive learning environments and reduce language barriers in education worldwide.

item.description: Gemini in Gmail on mobile devices can now reference Google Calendar, allowing users to quickly access and leverage their schedule information when composing emails or responding to messages. This integration enhances mobile productivity by providing contextual assistance for scheduling and communication directly within the email app.
