item.description: Google Docs now allows users to edit client-side encrypted (CSE) Microsoft Word files directly, providing enhanced security for collaborative work on sensitive documents. This feature improves interoperability and maintains data protection when working with Microsoft Office files within Google Workspace.

item.title: Google Vault improves Google Drive search and export: now with document ID and more shared drive options
item.description: Google Vault is receiving updates to its search and export capabilities for Google Drive, providing enhanced tools for eDiscovery, compliance, and information governance. These improvements enable administrators to more effectively manage and retrieve data from Drive for legal and regulatory purposes.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 16, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 16, 2025, cover deep research updates for Gemini from I/O 2025 and the open beta for Microsoft SharePoint Online migration to Google Workspace. Other announcements include Gemini's integration with Canvas for quiz generation, expanded language support for Google Classroom, and the ability to edit client-side encrypted Microsoft Word files with Google Docs.

item.title: Help, not hype: AI built for how you actually work
item.description: Google emphasizes Gemini's practical application for 'help, not hype,' showcasing how its AI capabilities genuinely assist users within Google Workspace applications. Gemini's integration streamlines daily tasks such as drafting emails in Gmail, summarizing documents in Google Docs, and generating ideas for presentations, providing tangible productivity benefits and enabling users to focus on meaningful work.

item.title: Upcoming Changes to Microsoft Exchange Migrations
item.description: Google Workspace is announcing upcoming changes to its migration tools for Microsoft Exchange, indicating improvements and expanded capabilities for transferring data to Google Workspace. These updates aim to simplify and accelerate the migration process for organizations transitioning from Exchange environments.

item.title: Extract and categorize data in AppSheet with the power of Gemini
item.description: AppSheet is integrating Gemini to enable users to automatically extract and categorize unstructured data from various sources using AI. This feature streamlines data processing workflows, making it easier for users to build intelligent applications without code and improve data organization.

item.title: Supercharging employee experience and reducing routine work with Gemini at ATB Financial
item.description: ATB Financial is supercharging its employee experience and significantly reducing routine work by integrating Gemini into Google Workspace across its operations. Gemini helps employees automate tasks like drafting communications and summarizing reports, allowing them to focus on strategic initiatives and customer engagement, leading to enhanced productivity and job satisfaction within the financial institution.

item.title: Google Workspace apps for Gmail, Google Drive, Google Docs, Calendar, Keep, and Tasks are now generally available for the Gemini app
item.description: Google Workspace applications are now generally available within the Gemini app, allowing users to seamlessly interact with Docs, Sheets, and Slides content through Gemini's AI interface. This integration provides a unified experience for leveraging generative AI across core Workspace tools, enhancing productivity and content creation.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Sheets to quickly add dropdowns, pivot tables, filters, and more
item.description: Gemini in Google Sheets is introducing advanced actions, allowing users to perform complex data manipulations, generate formulas, and automate tasks with natural language commands. This enhancement boosts productivity for data analysis and spreadsheet management, making powerful features more accessible to a wider audience.

item.title: Use Gemini in Drive to interact with folders in 20+ additional languages
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is expanding its language support and adding folder-level analysis, allowing users to summarize, query, and organize content across entire folders in multiple languages. This enhancement significantly improves information retrieval and productivity for multi-lingual teams managing large volumes of documents.

item.title: Wake Forest University redefines cybersecurity with Google Workspace for Education Plus
item.description: Wake Forest University is redefining its cybersecurity posture by implementing Google Workspace Education Plus, enhancing protection for its 8,700 students and staff. The advanced security features, including robust data loss prevention and sophisticated threat detection, help the university safeguard sensitive information, ensure compliance, and build a resilient digital environment against evolving cyber threats.

item.title: Conduct in-depth two-way conversations with Gemini Live
item.description: Gemini Live introduces in-depth, two-way voice conversations, allowing users to interact naturally and interrupt Gemini for adaptive responses. This feature is now globally available on the Gemini mobile app for Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, and Education upgrades, as well as Gemini Advanced subscribers. It enhances conversational AI interactions with real-time, fluid dialogue.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 9, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for May 9, 2025, announced several new features including granular OAuth consent for Workspace add-ons, Gemini support in Google Vault for Education customers, and Gemini Live for in-depth two-way conversations. Users can now also generate custom video clips in Google Vids, while administrators gain the ability to pre-configure the Gemini app conversation history setting, and Gmail is updating its support for the 3DES encryption cipher for incoming SMTP connections.

item.title: Gemini app reporting now available for all Google Workspace for Education customers
item.description: Google Vault is expanding to support Gemini app content for all Google Workspace for Education customers, including Fundamentals, Standard, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Plus editions. This update enables administrators to retain, hold, search, and export Gemini conversations, enhancing e-discovery and data governance for educational institutions. The gradual rollout began on May 9, 2025.

item.title: Fullstory writes collaboration into its culture with Google Workspace and Gemini
item.description: FullStory is fostering a stronger collaboration culture by leveraging Google Workspace with Gemini, enhancing productivity and creative workflows across its global teams. Gemini assists FullStory employees in streamlining content creation, summarizing complex data, and improving communication, allowing them to focus on customer experience insights and product development, leading to more efficient and impactful outcomes.

item.title: Beyond the prompt: How to create a Google Guides program to drive adoption of Workspace with Gemini
item.description: The Google Guides Program is designed to drive the adoption of Google Workspace with Gemini by equipping users with the knowledge and skills to move 'beyond the prompt.' This initiative provides practical guidance, training, and best practices for leveraging AI across applications like Gmail and Docs, helping users maximize productivity and creativity while addressing potential challenges.

item.title: Granular OAuth consent in HTTP Google Workspace add-ons
item.description: Google Workspace Add-ons now feature granular OAuth consent scopes, empowering users to grant specific, limited permissions to third-party add-ons rather than broad data access. This significantly enhances user security and transparency regarding data sharing. Developers are encouraged to update their add-ons to utilize these new scopes, which will become mandatory for all add-ons by late 2025.

item.title: Generate custom video clips in Google Vids with Veo 2
item.description: Google Vids now enables users to generate custom video clips from scratch using text prompts, leveraging its "Help me create" capabilities. This allows for specifying clip length, visual style, and types of shots like B-roll footage or abstract graphics, greatly simplifying video creation. The feature is available to all Google Vids users, enhancing AI-powered video production.

item.title: Gmail will soon stop support for the 3DES encryption cipher for incoming SMTP connections
item.description: Gmail is deprecating support for the outdated and vulnerable 3DES encryption cipher for incoming SMTP connections, effective May 22, 2025, for rapid release and June 5, 2025, for scheduled release domains. This security enhancement aims to protect user data by ensuring only modern, robust encryption ciphers are used for email communication. Administrators should verify their systems support current encryption standards to avoid service disruption.

item.title: Pre-configure Gemini app conversation history admin settings before they take effect
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now pre-configure the Gemini app conversation history setting, allowing them to set a default on/off state for new users or enforce a specific setting. This control over conversation history impacts Gemini's learning and personalization capabilities for users. The feature is available across Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education, and Nonprofits editions, enhancing administrative oversight.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 2, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for May 2, 2025, highlight two significant updates: users can now initiate conversations with Gemini directly within Google Drive about specific files to gain insights. Additionally, Google Voice has introduced three-way call support and received an updated user interface, enhancing communication capabilities.

item.title: Bringing human ingenuity and gen AI into creative harmony
item.description: MAS, a global apparel and textile manufacturer, is augmenting human ingenuity with generative AI within Google Workspace, significantly enhancing its design and operational processes. By using AI tools like Gemini to accelerate ideation, optimize workflows, and analyze complex data, MAS reduces time-to-market and fosters innovation across its creative teams, demonstrating the power of human-AI collaboration.

item.title: Google Voice gets support for three way calling and a refreshed in-call user interface
item.description: Google Voice has introduced three-way call support for all Workspace users, enabling them to easily add a third participant to an active call. Concurrently, the user interface across Google Voice's web, iOS, and Android platforms has been updated to enhance the overall user experience. This update, which began its gradual rollout on May 2, 2025, improves communication flexibility for businesses.

item.title: Start a conversation with Gemini in the side panel of Google Drive about specific files
item.description: Google Drive now allows users to start conversations with Gemini directly about specific files like Docs, Sheets, Slides, and PDFs, leveraging the file's content for context. Gemini can summarize documents, answer questions, and provide insights, enhancing productivity and understanding of file contents. This feature is available to Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers, with a gradual rollout from May 2, 2025.

item.title: Google named a leader in IDC Marketscape: Worldwide Team Collaboration Applications 2024 Vendor Assessment
item.description: Google Workspace has been named a Leader in the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Team Collaboration Applications 2024 Vendor Assessment, recognizing its robust suite of tools for enhancing teamwork and productivity. This acknowledgment highlights Google Workspace's strengths in integrating AI, fostering seamless communication, and supporting diverse organizational needs for effective collaboration.

item.title: Expanding Google Vids to Business Starter, Enterprise Starter and Nonprofit customers
item.description: Google Vids, the AI-powered video creation tool, is now expanding its availability to Google Workspace Business Starter, Enterprise Starter, and Nonprofits editions. This significant expansion provides more organizations with access to Vids' capabilities for generating engaging videos using AI. The gradual rollout commenced on April 29, 2025, broadening its reach beyond the previously supported Business Standard, Plus, Enterprise Standard, Plus, and Education Plus tiers.

item.title: Use NotebookLM to generate Audio Overviews more than 50 languages
item.description: NotebookLM's Audio Overviews feature is significantly expanding its language support to 35 new languages, including Spanish, French, German, Japanese, and Korean. This update enables users worldwide to listen to AI-generated summaries of their research sources in their preferred language. The enhancement is available to all NotebookLM users, improving accessibility and research efficiency.

item.title: Express yourself and quickly respond to emails with emojis reactions in Gmail
item.description: Gmail has introduced emoji reactions, allowing users to quickly and visually respond to emails without composing a full message, mirroring functionality in other messaging platforms. This feature is available on both web and mobile platforms for Google Workspace accounts, though it is not supported for client-side encrypted messages. The gradual rollout of emoji reactions began on April 30, 2025.

item.title: Because you asked: My favorite ways to use Gemini at work
item.description: This article highlights favorite practical ways to use Gemini in daily work within Google Workspace, focusing on boosting personal productivity and streamlining common tasks. Examples include generating professional emails in Gmail, summarizing long documents in Google Docs, brainstorming ideas for presentations, and quickly extracting key information from various sources, making workflows more efficient and less time-consuming.

item.title: Enhance Your Organization’s Security with Out-of-Domain File Warnings in Google Workspace
item.description: Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides are introducing new out-of-domain file warnings to enhance data security for Google Workspace users. These warnings will alert users when they open files originating from outside their organization's trusted domain, helping to prevent accidental data leakage. This feature, gradually rolling out from April 24, 2025, is particularly beneficial for users leveraging Advanced Protection Program or strict Workspace security settings.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - April 25, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for April 25, 2025, announced several updates, including the expansion of NotebookLM's Audio Overviews to 35 new languages and the introduction of out-of-domain file warnings in Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides for enhanced security. Additionally, Google Vids is now available for Business Starter, Enterprise Starter, and Nonprofits editions, while Gmail users can enjoy new emoji reactions.

item.title: Three best practices to simplify eDiscovery exports and litigation holds with Google Vault
item.description: Google Vault offers three best practices to simplify eDiscovery exports and litigation holds, crucial for legal and compliance teams managing data within Google Workspace. These practices include organizing data effectively, leveraging advanced search and export functionalities, and implementing consistent retention policies to ensure legal defensibility and streamline complex data requests.

item.title: Beyond the Prompt: ATB Financial’s 5 tips to drive Workspace with Gemini adoption
item.description: ATB Financial shares five key tips for driving successful adoption of Google Workspace with Gemini, emphasizing change management, clear communication, and empowering employees. Strategies include creating internal champions, providing tailored training, celebrating early successes, and focusing on practical use cases that deliver immediate value to teams across the organization, fostering a culture of AI integration.

item.title: April Workspace feature drop: New AI features across Gemini, Chat, Gmail, and Slides to boost your productivity
item.description: The April Google Workspace feature drop introduces new AI enhancements across Gemini, Google Chat, Gmail, and Google Slides, aiming to boost productivity and collaboration. Updates include smarter drafting in Gmail, AI-powered summaries in Chat, and advanced content generation in Slides, enabling users to streamline workflows and create compelling content more efficiently.

item.title: Introducing Frontline Plus: Enhanced Security and AI features for Frontline Workers
item.description: Google Workspace Frontline Plus is a new offering designed for frontline workers, enhancing Frontline Standard with advanced security and AI capabilities. This comprehensive suite includes sophisticated Data Loss Prevention (DLP), a security center, email encryption, AppSheet Core, and Gemini Business, providing robust tools for a critical workforce. Frontline Plus became available for purchase on April 24, 2025.

item.title: Data classifications labels for Gmail are now generally available
item.description: Gmail Data Classification Labels are now generally available, providing administrators with the ability to apply labels like "Internal" or "Confidential" to emails. This feature helps enforce Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules, automate security policies, and educate users on sensitive data handling practices. Available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus, Education Plus, and existing Drive and Chat classification labels, it enhances data security and compliance across organizations.

item.title: Introducing even more high-quality Google Slides templates to elevate your presentations
item.description: Google Slides is significantly expanding its template gallery with the addition of even more high-quality, modern templates designed to facilitate the creation of professional and engaging presentations. This update provides Google Workspace users with a wider array of design options and layouts. The new templates are available to all Google Workspace users, enhancing productivity and visual appeal.

item.title: Adding new capabilities to student groups in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Classroom is rolling out new student group capabilities, enabling educators to easily create and manage student groups for collaborative assignments and differentiated instruction. This enhancement supports teamwork and personalized learning experiences within the classroom. The feature is available to Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers, with a gradual rollout beginning April 23, 2025.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - April 18, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for April 18, 2025, announced the general availability of data classification labels for Gmail, offering enhanced security. New high-quality templates were added to Google Slides, and Google Classroom gained new student group capabilities. The new Frontline Plus SKU was introduced with enhanced security and AI features, and Google Meet expanded language support for "Take notes for me," recorded captions, and meeting transcripts.

item.title: Updates for configuring your preferred language for “Take notes for me”, recorded captions, and meeting transcripts
item.description: Google Meet is significantly expanding language support for its AI-powered features, including "Take notes for me," recorded captions, and meeting transcripts, to include 12 new languages, bringing the total to 21. Users can now configure their preferred language within Meet settings. This update enhances accessibility and productivity for Google Workspace Business Standard, Plus, Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: Introducing the ability to grade and assign grading labels in bulk in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Classroom has introduced a new feature enabling educators to grade and assign grading labels, such as "Missing" or "Late," in bulk for assignments. This enhancement significantly streamlines the grading workflow, saving teachers valuable time. The feature is available to Google Workspace for Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Education Standard customers, improving efficiency in classroom management.

item.title: Cloud Next ‘25 recap: Discover how Workspace with Gemini is driving business results with these on-demand sessions
item.description: Google Cloud Next '25 featured numerous on-demand sessions showcasing how Google Workspace with Gemini is transforming business productivity and collaboration. Key topics included generative AI applications for content creation, data analysis, enhanced security features, and customer success stories demonstrating significant efficiency gains across various industries.

item.title: Google Classroom is expanding to 7 additional languages
item.description: Google Classroom is expanding its user interface to support seven additional languages: Arabic, Danish, Finnish, Hebrew, Hindi, Norwegian, and Swedish, enhancing global accessibility. This update makes the platform more inclusive for a diverse international audience of educators and students. The expanded language support is available to all Google Workspace for Education customers, fostering broader adoption and engagement.

item.title: Introducing silent reading mode in Google Classroom’s Read Along
item.description: Google Classroom's "Read Along" feature is introducing a new silent reading mode, allowing students to practice reading independently without audio prompts or feedback. This mode still provides AI-powered insights on reading performance, such as fluency and accuracy, to teachers. Available for Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers, this enhances personalized reading practice and assessment.

item.title: Control Workspace Business and Enterprise users’ access to new Google Workspace with Gemini features before general availability
item.description: Google Workspace administrators now have the ability to control access to Gemini Alpha features for their Business and Enterprise users, providing greater oversight of experimental AI capabilities. This enables organizations to manage early access to new Gemini functionalities while maintaining control over their Workspace environment. The gradual rollout of this administrative control began on April 17, 2025, enhancing security and feature management.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Classroom to generate questions or a quiz based on specific text
item.description: Google Classroom is integrating Gemini to empower educators with an AI-powered tool for generating questions directly from text content, such as articles or handouts. This feature streamlines the creation of quizzes, discussion prompts, and study guides, saving teachers valuable time in preparing learning materials. It is available to Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Google Docs code blocks now available in additional programming languages
item.description: Google Docs is significantly enhancing its code block feature by adding support for 12 new programming languages, bringing the total to 30, with improved syntax highlighting. New additions include Bash, Swift, Scala, R, and Kotlin, catering to a broader range of developers. This update, available to all Google Workspace users, greatly improves collaboration and documentation for technical teams.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - April 11, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for April 11, 2025, detail several updates, including enhanced admin control over Gemini Alpha features for Business/Enterprise users and a new silent reading mode in Google Classroom's Read Along. Google Classroom also expanded its UI to seven new languages and integrated Gemini for generating questions from text. Google Docs now supports 12 additional programming languages in code blocks, and Gemini App and Gemini for Workspace received BSI C5 attestation.

item.title: More choice for Google Meet hardware: Introducing our partnership with Neat
item.description: Google Meet Hardware is expanding its ecosystem by partnering with Neat, a leading video conferencing device manufacturer, offering customers more choice and flexibility for meeting room solutions. This collaboration integrates Neat's innovative devices with Google Meet, enhancing the video conferencing experience with advanced features and reliable hardware for seamless collaboration within Google Workspace.

item.title: The Gemini app, as well as Gemini features in Google Workspace, are now BSI C5 certified
item.description: The Gemini App and Gemini for Google Workspace have successfully achieved BSI C5 attestation, a rigorous German government cloud security standard. This certification underscores Google's strong commitment to robust security and data protection, providing critical assurance for organizations in regulated industries, especially within Germany. This milestone is expected to boost enterprise adoption and trust in Gemini's capabilities.

item.title: Save time making changes or updates to AI voiceovers in Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids is expanding its AI voiceover capabilities to support additional languages, enabling users to generate natural-sounding narrations for videos in a wider linguistic range. This enhancement makes video content more globally accessible and inclusive. The updated AI voiceover feature is available to all Google Vids users, streamlining multilingual video production.

item.title: New AI capabilities in Workspace to help every business drive results
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out new AI features, primarily through Gemini, designed to drive tangible business results by boosting productivity and fostering innovation. These AI capabilities help automate tasks such as content drafting, data analysis, and summarizing information, enabling businesses to make faster decisions and improve efficiency across their operations, from small businesses to large enterprises.

item.title: Reference your Google Calendar using Gemini in the side panel of Gmail in additional languages
item.description: Gemini can now reference Google Calendar information using additional languages beyond English, making the AI assistant more versatile for a global user base. This enhancement allows Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers, to inquire about their schedules in their preferred language. This improves accessibility and productivity for international teams.

item.title: Preview summaries in the Google Chat home view now available in three additional languages
item.description: Gemini's AI-powered summarization feature within Google Chat is now accessible in additional languages beyond English, benefiting global teams with increased efficiency and comprehension. This allows users to quickly grasp the essence of chat conversations in their preferred language. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Educators can now upload content to Read Along in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Classroom's "Read Along" feature now enables educators to upload their own content, such as PDFs or Google Docs, for students to use in reading practice. This update provides teachers with increased flexibility to customize reading assignments with relevant materials. The feature is available to Google Workspace for Education Plus and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers, enhancing personalized learning.

item.title: Create and manage grading periods using the Google Classroom API
item.description: The Google Classroom API now supports programmatic creation and management of grading periods, enabling developers to integrate with Student Information Systems (SIS) and automate administrative tasks. This enhancement provides greater flexibility for schools and districts to manage academic timelines efficiently. The feature is available to all Google Workspace for Education customers, fostering streamlined educational workflows.

item.title: MAS gets more out of its creative workflows using Google Workspace with Gemini
item.description: MAS, a global apparel and textile manufacturer, is leveraging Gemini within Google Workspace to significantly enhance its creative workflows, allowing designers to generate ideas and refine concepts more efficiently. This AI integration helps MAS streamline the design process, accelerate content creation, and improve collaboration across its teams, leading to faster product development cycles and increased innovation in a competitive industry.

item.title: Help me write in Google Docs now available in four additional languages
item.description: Gemini's "Help me write" feature in Google Docs is expanding its language support to include additional languages beyond English, enabling users to leverage AI for drafting, refining, and generating content more broadly. This enhancement makes AI-powered writing assistance more accessible and efficient for diverse linguistic needs. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: Help me write in Gmail now available in Japanese and Korean
item.description: Gemini's "Help me write" feature in Gmail is expanding its language support beyond English, enabling users to draft emails with AI-powered assistance in a wider array of languages. This makes the AI writing tool more accessible and useful for a global user base. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - April 4, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for April 4, 2025, detail significant updates including the Google Classroom API now supporting grading period management and Read Along allowing content uploads. Gemini's "Help me write" feature in Gmail and Docs, and Gemini summaries in Chat, received language expansions. Google Vids' AI voiceovers were updated, and a beta for more Workspace data export options was launched. Additionally, NotebookLM and the Gemini app were designated core services for education, with updates to NotebookLM sources, and admins gained control over Workspace app access in Gemini.

item.title: More options for exporting your Google Workspace data are available in open beta
item.description: Google Workspace is initiating an Open Beta to provide administrators with expanded options for exporting organizational data, likely through Google Takeout, enhancing data governance and compliance. This update offers greater flexibility and control over data portability, crucial for fulfilling regulatory requirements and internal policies. The beta program allows organizations to test these new export capabilities before general availability.

item.title: How-to guide: Adopting Zero-Trust security with Google Workspace
item.description: This article outlines a strategic approach to adopting Zero Trust security principles within Google Workspace, emphasizing continuous verification and least privilege access. Key steps include implementing strong authentication with passkeys, micro-segmentation, and advanced threat detection, providing comprehensive guidance for organizations to enhance their cybersecurity posture and protect sensitive data from evolving threats.

item.title: NotebookLM and the Gemini app are now Core Services with enterprise-grade data protection for all education customers
item.description: NotebookLM and the Gemini App have been officially designated as core services for Google Workspace for Education customers, affirming their adherence to Google's strict privacy and security standards for educational environments. This designation guarantees no ads and no use of student data for advertising purposes, providing schools and districts with trusted, AI-powered tools for learning and productivity. This is a significant step for secure AI adoption in education.

item.title: Pre-configure the Google Workspace apps admin setting for the Gemini app ahead of general availability
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now pre-configure user access to Google Workspace applications like Gmail, Drive, and Docs within Gemini, ahead of its general availability. This crucial administrative control enables organizations to proactively manage data access and enforce compliance policies before Gemini's full rollout. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education, and Nonprofits editions, ensuring controlled AI integration.

item.title: Introducing updates to sources for NotebookLM and NotebookLM Plus
item.description: NotebookLM and NotebookLM Plus are receiving updates to expand their supported sources, enabling users to import and analyze information from a wider array of file types and platforms. This enhancement significantly boosts the AI's capability to process diverse content and generate comprehensive insights. The update is available for all NotebookLM users, increasing its versatility for research and learning.

item.title: New in Gmail: Making end-to-end encrypted emails easy to use for all organizations
item.description: Gmail is rolling out easy-to-use client-side end-to-end encryption for all businesses, significantly enhancing data privacy and security for sensitive communications. This feature allows organizations to maintain control over encryption keys, ensuring that even Google cannot access the content of encrypted emails, thereby meeting stringent compliance requirements for regulated industries within Google Workspace.

item.title: Support for continuous framing on select Logitech Google Meet on ChromeOS
item.description: Google Meet is enhancing its video conferencing capabilities with the introduction of Continuous Framing for Logitech Series One Room Kits. This AI-powered feature automatically adjusts camera framing to ensure all participants remain optimally visible and positioned during meetings, even if they move. This significantly improves the in-room meeting experience by providing dynamic and intelligent camera control.

item.title: Creating visually stunning presentations in Google Slides just got easier
item.description: Google Slides is introducing new AI-powered features and design tools to make creating visually stunning presentations easier and more efficient within Google Workspace. These enhancements include intelligent layout suggestions, improved image and video integration, and advanced text formatting options, empowering users to produce professional and engaging presentations with less effort.

item.title: Introducing Audio Overviews, now available in the Gemini app
item.description: The Gemini App is launching an "Audio Overview" feature, which provides users with AI-generated audio summaries of complex topics or lengthy documents. This enhancement significantly improves accessibility and comprehension, offering a quick and convenient way to absorb information. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, and Education upgrades, as well as Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: New sidebar with design elements in Google Slides makes building presentations easier
item.description: Google Slides is rolling out a redesigned sidebar featuring new design elements to enhance the presentation creation process. This update aims to streamline user workflow by providing easier access to tools for formatting, layout, and content insertion. The improved user interface is available to all Google Workspace users, making professional presentation design more intuitive and efficient.

item.title: Help me create in Google Docs now available in seven additional languages
item.description: Gemini's "Help me create" feature in Google Docs is expanding its language support, enabling users to generate entirely new documents or sections from text prompts in additional languages. This AI-powered content generation tool broadens its accessibility for diverse linguistic needs. The feature is available to Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: Improve communication and representation with Dynamic layouts in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is rolling out dynamic layouts that intelligently adjust participant tiles based on ongoing meeting activity and shared content. This enhancement aims to optimize screen space and improve visibility for all participants, making virtual meetings more engaging and efficient. The dynamic layouts are available to all Google Workspace users, improving the overall video conferencing experience.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - March 28, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for March 28, 2025, introduced dynamic layouts for Google Meet and additional language support for Gemini in Drive's PDF viewer. Google Slides gained proportional scaling for objects, while Google Drive received new nudges for Gemini, and Gmail's "Help me write" expanded to more languages. Google Classroom's mobile app also expanded language support, and Google Drive now runs on ARM-compatible Windows PCs. Lastly, Google Vids received new "Help me create" capabilities.

item.title: March Workspace feature drop: More effective meetings, AI features for Vids, and more language capabilities
item.description: The March Google Workspace feature drop brings new AI capabilities and enhancements across various applications, significantly boosting productivity and collaboration. Key updates include smarter drafting in Gmail, improved data analysis in Google Sheets, and advanced content generation with Gemini, designed to streamline workflows and foster creativity for users.

item.title: Gemini in Drive PDF Viewer is now available in 20+ additional languages
item.description: Gemini's integration within the Google Drive PDF viewer is now accessible in additional languages, enabling users to leverage AI for summarizing, querying, and extracting information from PDFs in diverse linguistic contexts. This enhances productivity and document comprehension for a broader global audience. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: Interview: Thinking through the ethics of AI assistants with Iason Gabriel from Google DeepMind
item.description: Iason Gabriel from Google DeepMind discusses the critical importance of thinking through the ethics of AI assistants, emphasizing responsible development and deployment. The article highlights considerations such as fairness, privacy, transparency, and accountability, guiding the ethical integration of AI tools like Gemini into platforms like Google Workspace to ensure beneficial and trustworthy applications.

item.title: Because you asked: Reviewing how you use your time
item.description: This article offers practical strategies for reviewing and optimizing time usage within Google Workspace to enhance productivity and focus. Tips include leveraging Google Calendar's time insights, tracking task completion in Google Tasks, and minimizing distractions by customizing notifications, helping users gain a clearer understanding of their workday and identify areas for efficiency improvement.

item.title: Google Slides introduces proportional scaling for objects to maintain visual clarity
item.description: Google Slides has introduced proportional scaling for objects, such as images, shapes, and text boxes, which now scale proportionally by default when dragged from their corners. Users can hold the Shift key to override this behavior. This enhancement simplifies design consistency and makes it easier for all Google Workspace users to create professional-looking presentations.

item.title: The ability to run Google Drive on Arm-compatible Windows PCs is now generally available
item.description: Google Drive for desktop now officially supports ARM-compatible Windows PCs, enabling users with modern devices featuring Snapdragon processors to run the application natively. This compatibility enhancement is expected to improve performance and extend battery life for these specific Windows users. This update broadens Google Drive's accessibility and optimization across different hardware architectures.

item.title: Use the Google Classroom Mobile App in additional languages
item.description: The Google Classroom mobile app is significantly expanding its language support, improving accessibility for a broader global user base of students and educators. This enhancement allows users to interact with the application in more native languages. This is part of Google's ongoing effort to make educational tools more inclusive worldwide.

item.title: Get started with Gemini in Google Drive quickly with new “nudges”
item.description: Google Drive is rolling out new "nudges" designed to encourage users to leverage Gemini for tasks such as summarizing documents, generating new content, or organizing files. These contextual prompts aim to boost Gemini adoption and enhance productivity directly within Google Drive. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: Help me write in Gmail now available in three additional languages
item.description: Gemini's "Help me write" feature in Gmail is expanding its language support beyond English, enabling users to draft emails with AI-powered assistance in a wider array of languages. This makes the AI writing tool more accessible and useful for a global user base. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: How MEDITECH is integrating Gemini into highly regulated healthcare workflows
item.description: MEDITECH, a leading Electronic Health Record (EHR) vendor, is integrating Gemini into its highly regulated healthcare workflows, demonstrating how AI can enhance efficiency while maintaining strict compliance. This partnership allows MEDITECH to leverage Gemini within Google Workspace for tasks like summarizing clinical notes and drafting administrative communications, accelerating operations without compromising patient data privacy or regulatory standards.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - March 21, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for March 21, 2025, announced new features including contextual smart replies for Business/Enterprise customers and enhancements to NotebookLM. Gemini integrations expanded with new languages for the Chat and Slides side panels, and a new "Canvas" interface for the Gemini App was introduced, alongside summaries of shared Workspace files in Google Chat and a new Gemini-powered summary building block in Google Docs. Gmail DLP was updated with sensitive content snippets and instant rule application, NotebookLM gained context-aware access, and a beta launched for converting client-side encrypted documents after Vault or Takeout export.

item.title: Contextual Smart Replies now available for Google Workspace Business and Enterprise editions
item.description: Contextual Smart Replies, an AI-powered feature offering intelligent, context-aware response suggestions, are now available to Google Workspace Business and Enterprise customers. This enhancement is designed to improve communication efficiency and speed across various channels, such as Google Chat and Gmail. By providing relevant response options, it helps users reply faster and maintain conversational flow, boosting productivity in professional settings.

item.title: Adding new capabilities to Google Vids’ ‘Help me create’
item.description: Google Vids is introducing new "Help me create" capabilities, empowering users to generate more complex and customized video content through enhanced AI prompts. This expands the tool's capacity to assist with video production, providing greater creative control and streamlining the video creation workflow. The new features are available to all Google Vids users, fostering more sophisticated AI-powered video development.

item.title: Beyond the prompt: How to measure the value Gemini brings to your company
item.description: This article explains how to measure the value Gemini brings to a company, moving beyond simple prompts to quantify ROI and impact within Google Workspace. Key metrics include time saved on routine tasks, improved content quality, faster data analysis, and enhanced employee satisfaction, providing a framework for organizations to assess the tangible benefits of AI adoption and demonstrate business value.

item.title: New features available in NotebookLM and NotebookLM Plus
item.description: NotebookLM is rolling out new features, likely enhancing its AI capabilities for summarizing, querying, and organizing research materials, further solidifying its role as an AI-powered research assistant. These updates aim to improve the platform's utility and efficiency for users conducting in-depth research. The new features are available to all NotebookLM users, fostering more effective information synthesis.

item.title: Gemini in Workspace apps and the Gemini app are first to achieve FedRAMP High authorization
item.description: Gemini in Workspace apps and the standalone Gemini app have achieved FedRAMP High Authorization, making Google the first to offer generative AI capabilities at this stringent security level for U.S. government agencies. This critical authorization ensures that federal customers can securely leverage AI for tasks like data analysis and content generation within Google Workspace, meeting the highest standards for cloud security and data protection.

item.title: 5 ways to help your small business thrive with Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive offers five essential ways to help small businesses thrive, focusing on secure collaboration, efficient file management, and robust data backup. These include easy sharing, version control, offline access, integration with Google Workspace apps, and reliable cloud storage, empowering small businesses to improve productivity and ensure business continuity.

item.title: Beta update: Data loss prevention rules based on classification labels are now applied instantly in Gmail on the web
item.description: Gmail Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules and classification labels are now applied instantly, drastically reducing the latency between policy definition and enforcement. This ensures more immediate and effective protection against sensitive data leakage, enhancing organizational security posture. The improved real-time enforcement is available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers.

item.title: Use Gemini in the side panel of Google Slides in even more languages
item.description: Gemini's integration within the Google Slides side panel is now available in many new languages, allowing users to leverage AI assistance for presentation tasks like generating slides and writing content in diverse linguistic contexts. This significantly enhances productivity and creative potential for a global audience. The feature is available to Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Use Gemini in the side panel of Google Chat in additional languages
item.description: Gemini's integration within the Google Chat side panel is now available in new languages, allowing users to access AI assistance such as summarization and drafting directly within their chat conversations. This expansion enhances productivity and collaboration for global teams. The feature is available to Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Try Canvas, a new way to collaborate with the Gemini app
item.description: The Gemini App is launching "Canvas," an innovative interactive workspace designed for users to visually brainstorm, organize thoughts, and develop ideas with Gemini's AI assistance. This flexible interface supports both creative and analytical tasks, enhancing productivity and ideation. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, and Education upgrades, as well as Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: See summaries of shared Google Docs, Slides, or Sheets files directly in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat will now automatically generate summaries of shared Google Workspace files, including Docs, Sheets, Slides, and PDFs, when they are linked in a chat conversation. This AI-powered feature enables users to quickly grasp the essence of a document without leaving Google Chat, significantly improving workflow efficiency. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, and Teaching and Learning Upgrade customers.

item.title: Gmail data loss prevention now supports “sensitive content snippets”
item.description: Gmail Data Loss Prevention (DLP) has been enhanced to provide administrators with sensitive content snippets, offering a small excerpt of flagged content when a DLP rule is triggered. This provides better context for policy violations without exposing the entire sensitive document, improving incident response and privacy. The feature is available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers.

item.title: Available in beta: Convert your client-side encrypted documents after a Vault or Takeout export
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing a beta feature that allows for the conversion of client-side encrypted (CSE) documents into a readable format after export from Google Vault or Google Takeout. This critical update addresses challenges in e-discovery and data portability for CSE content, enabling organizations to decrypt and review sensitive data. The beta is available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers.

item.title: Introducing a new building block that summarizes content with Gemini in Google Docs
item.description: Google Docs is rolling out a new building block that allows users to easily insert AI-generated summaries of their documents, powered by Gemini, directly into the document itself. This feature significantly enhances collaboration and enables quick comprehension of lengthy content. It is available to Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users.

item.title: Upcoming changes to how retention policies are applied to 1:1 direct messages in Google Chat
item.description: Google Workspace is updating its retention policy for direct messages that involve external participants, offering administrators more granular control over how long these chat messages are retained via Google Vault. This change helps organizations better address their compliance and data governance requirements for external communications. The update provides enhanced flexibility in managing data lifecycles for sensitive interactions.

item.title: Admins can now deploy Context-Aware Access for NotebookLM and NotebookLM Plus
item.description: NotebookLM is now integrating with Google Workspace's Context-Aware Access policies, enabling administrators to implement granular access controls based on user context such as device, location, or IP address. This enhances security and compliance for sensitive research data within NotebookLM. The feature is available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers, ensuring secure access to AI-powered research tools.

item.title: Introducing AppSheet User Pass
item.description: AppSheet is implementing a minor update to its user authentication process, likely aimed at streamlining login flows or improving integration with Google Workspace identity management. This change seeks to enhance the user experience and administrative ease for AppSheet applications. Further details on the specific impact for users and administrators were provided in the broader release notes.

item.title: Consent re-confirmation for under 18 users accessing Additional Services will soon be required
item.description: Google Workspace for Education is implementing consent reconfirmation for under-18 users attempting to access "additional services" (non-core Google services). This ensures strict compliance with child privacy regulations like COPPA and GDPR, providing parents and guardians with renewed control over their children's data sharing. It reinforces data protection for minors in educational environments.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - March 14, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for March 14, 2025, announced several updates, including consent reconfirmation for under-18 Education users and AppSheet user authentication bypass. Gemini Gems (Deep Research) became available to more Workspace customers, while Google Meet expanded language support for "Take notes for me," recorded captions, and transcripts. Authenticated AppSheet apps can now be embedded in Google Sites, and Google Docs client-side encryption supports export to Microsoft Word. More AI features rolled out for Business/Enterprise, Gemini side panel added four languages, and Google Meet hardware can view guest lists. Finally, Gemini in Drive gained file/folder creation, and Gemini in Gmail can add Calendar events.

item.title: BLADE takes air travel to new heights with Google Workspace
item.description: BLADE, a leading urban air mobility company, is taking air travel to new heights by leveraging Google Workspace to streamline operations and enhance collaboration. Google Workspace, including Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Meet, enables BLADE to manage complex logistics, coordinate flights, and communicate seamlessly across its global teams, supporting efficient customer service and rapid expansion.

item.title: Deep Research and Gems in the Gemini app are now available for more Google Workspace customers
item.description: Gemini Gems, offering advanced deep research capabilities such as synthesizing information from multiple sources, is now accessible to a broader range of Google Workspace customers. This expansion extends AI-powered research tools beyond initial early access. It is available for Business Standard/Plus, Enterprise Standard/Plus, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users, enhancing scholarly and business intelligence.

item.title: The future of work is here: Top Workspace sessions you don’t want to miss at Cloud Next ’25
item.description: Google Cloud Next '25 highlighted top Google Workspace sessions focused on transforming work with AI, featuring deep dives into Gemini's capabilities and practical applications. Sessions covered topics like enhancing productivity in Google Docs and Sheets, improving collaboration with AI-powered features, and ensuring enterprise-grade security and compliance within the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: More languages are available for recorded captions and transcripts in Google Meet
item.description: Google Meet is expanding its language support for recorded captions and meeting transcripts, making meeting recordings more accessible and reviewable for a broader global audience. This enhancement benefits Google Workspace Business Standard, Plus, Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users. The update ensures comprehensive linguistic support for post-meeting analysis and compliance.

item.title: Embed AppSheet apps directly in Google Sites
item.description: Authenticated AppSheet applications can now be seamlessly embedded directly into Google Sites, enabling robust integration of custom business apps within an easy-to-use website builder. This enhancement improves workflow, secures data access, and provides a unified experience for users needing interactive applications on their Google Sites. The feature streamlines internal tool deployment and access.

item.title: “Take notes for me” in Google Meet is available in seven additional languages

item.title: Export your client-side encrypted documents to Microsoft Word files

It bridges the gap between Google Workspace and external collaborators needing to view CSE content.

item.description: Google Workspace Business and Enterprise editions are gaining access to an expanded suite of AI-powered features across multiple applications, designed to boost productivity, automation, and intelligent assistance for corporate users. The enhancements aim to streamline workflows and provide competitive advantages for businesses of all sizes within the Workspace ecosystem.
